3044 m = key_setsadbmsg(type, 0, SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC, seq, pid,
3045 key_sp_refcnt(sp), M_WAITOK);
3046 result = m;
3047
3048 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC,
3049 &sp->spidx.src.sa, sp->spidx.prefs, sp->spidx.ul_proto, M_WAITOK);
3050 m_cat(result, m);
3051
3052 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST,
3053 &sp->spidx.dst.sa, sp->spidx.prefd, sp->spidx.ul_proto, M_WAITOK);
3054 m_cat(result, m);
3055
3056 m = key_sp2msg(sp, M_WAITOK);
3057 m_cat(result, m);
3058
3059 KASSERT(result->m_flags & M_PKTHDR);
3060 KASSERT(result->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
3061
3062 result->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
3063 for (m = result; m; m = m->m_next)
3064 result->m_pkthdr.len += m->m_len;
3065
3066 mtod(result, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_len =
3067 PFKEY_UNIT64(result->m_pkthdr.len);
3068
3069 return result;
3070}
3071
3072/*
3073 * get PFKEY message length for security policy and request.
3074 */
3075static u_int
3076key_getspreqmsglen(const struct secpolicy *sp)
3077{
3078 u_int tlen;
3079
3080 tlen = sizeof(struct sadb_x_policy);
3081
3082 /* if is the policy for ipsec ? */
3083 if (sp->policy != IPSEC_POLICY_IPSEC)
3084 return tlen;
3085
3086 /* get length of ipsec requests */
3087 {
3088 const struct ipsecrequest *isr;
3089 int len;
3090
3091 for (isr = sp->req; isr != NULL; isr = isr->next) {
3092 len = sizeof(struct sadb_x_ipsecrequest)
3093 + isr->saidx.src.sa.sa_len + isr->saidx.dst.sa.sa_len;
3094
3095 tlen += PFKEY_ALIGN8(len);
3096 }
3097 }
3098
3099 return tlen;
3100}
3101
3102/*
3103 * SADB_SPDEXPIRE processing
3104 * send
3105 * <base, address(SD), lifetime(CH), policy>
3106 * to KMD by PF_KEY.
3107 *
3108 * OUT: 0 : succeed
3109 * others : error number
3110 */
3111static int
3112key_spdexpire(struct secpolicy *sp)
3113{
3114 int s;
3115 struct mbuf *result = NULL, *m;
3116 int len;
3117 int error = -1;
3118 struct sadb_lifetime *lt;
3119
3120 /* XXX: Why do we lock ? */
3121 s = splsoftnet(); /*called from softclock()*/
3122
3123 KASSERT(sp != NULL);
3124
3125 /* set msg header */
3126 m = key_setsadbmsg(SADB_X_SPDEXPIRE, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, M_WAITOK);
3127 result = m;
3128
3129 /* create lifetime extension (current and hard) */
3130 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(*lt)) * 2;
3131 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
3132 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
3133
3134 memset(mtod(m, void *), 0, len);
3135 lt = mtod(m, struct sadb_lifetime *);
3136 lt->sadb_lifetime_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime));
3137 lt->sadb_lifetime_exttype = SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_CURRENT;
3138 lt->sadb_lifetime_allocations = 0;
3139 lt->sadb_lifetime_bytes = 0;
3140 lt->sadb_lifetime_addtime = time_mono_to_wall(sp->created);
3141 lt->sadb_lifetime_usetime = time_mono_to_wall(sp->lastused);
3142 lt = (struct sadb_lifetime *)(mtod(m, char *) + len / 2);
3143 lt->sadb_lifetime_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime));
3144 lt->sadb_lifetime_exttype = SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD;
3145 lt->sadb_lifetime_allocations = 0;
3146 lt->sadb_lifetime_bytes = 0;
3147 lt->sadb_lifetime_addtime = sp->lifetime;
3148 lt->sadb_lifetime_usetime = sp->validtime;
3149 m_cat(result, m);
3150
3151 /* set sadb_address for source */
3152 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC, &sp->spidx.src.sa,
3153 sp->spidx.prefs, sp->spidx.ul_proto, M_WAITOK);
3154 m_cat(result, m);
3155
3156 /* set sadb_address for destination */
3157 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST, &sp->spidx.dst.sa,
3158 sp->spidx.prefd, sp->spidx.ul_proto, M_WAITOK);
3159 m_cat(result, m);
3160
3161 /* set secpolicy */
3162 m = key_sp2msg(sp, M_WAITOK);
3163 m_cat(result, m);
3164
3165 KASSERT(result->m_flags & M_PKTHDR);
3166 KASSERT(result->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
3167
3168 result->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
3169 for (m = result; m; m = m->m_next)
3170 result->m_pkthdr.len += m->m_len;
3171
3172 mtod(result, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_len =
3173 PFKEY_UNIT64(result->m_pkthdr.len);
3174
3175 error = key_sendup_mbuf(NULL, result, KEY_SENDUP_REGISTERED);
3176 splx(s);
3177 return error;
3178}
3179
3180/* %%% SAD management */
3181/*
3182 * allocating a memory for new SA head, and copy from the values of mhp.
3183 * OUT: NULL : failure due to the lack of memory.
3184 * others : pointer to new SA head.
3185 */
3186static struct secashead *
3187key_newsah(const struct secasindex *saidx)
3188{
3189 struct secashead *newsah;
3190 int i;
3191
3192 KASSERT(saidx != NULL);
3193
3194 newsah = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(struct secashead), KM_SLEEP);
3195 for (i = 0; i < __arraycount(newsah->savlist); i++)
3196 PSLIST_INIT(&newsah->savlist[i]);
3197 newsah->saidx = *saidx;
3198
3199 localcount_init(&newsah->localcount);
3200 /* Take a reference for the caller */
3201 localcount_acquire(&newsah->localcount);
3202
3203 /* Add to the sah list */
3204 SAHLIST_ENTRY_INIT(newsah);
3205 newsah->state = SADB_SASTATE_MATURE;
3206 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
3207 SAHLIST_WRITER_INSERT_HEAD(newsah);
3208 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
3209
3210 return newsah;
3211}
3212
3213static bool
3214key_sah_has_sav(struct secashead *sah)
3215{
3216 u_int state;
3217
3218 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_sad.lock));
3219
3220 SASTATE_ANY_FOREACH(state) {
3221 if (!SAVLIST_WRITER_EMPTY(sah, state))
3222 return true;
3223 }
3224
3225 return false;
3226}
3227
3228static void
3229key_unlink_sah(struct secashead *sah)
3230{
3231
3232 KASSERT(!cpu_softintr_p());
3233 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_sad.lock));
3234 KASSERT(sah->state == SADB_SASTATE_DEAD);
3235
3236 /* Remove from the sah list */
3237 SAHLIST_WRITER_REMOVE(sah);
3238
3239 KDASSERT(mutex_ownable(softnet_lock));
3240 key_sad_pserialize_perform();
3241
3242 localcount_drain(&sah->localcount, &key_sad.cv_lc, &key_sad.lock);
3243}
3244
3245static void
3246key_destroy_sah(struct secashead *sah)
3247{
3248
3249 rtcache_free(&sah->sa_route);
3250
3251 SAHLIST_ENTRY_DESTROY(sah);
3252 localcount_fini(&sah->localcount);
3253
3254 if (sah->idents != NULL)
3255 kmem_free(sah->idents, sah->idents_len);
3256 if (sah->identd != NULL)
3257 kmem_free(sah->identd, sah->identd_len);
3258
3259 kmem_free(sah, sizeof(*sah));
3260}
3261
3262/*
3263 * allocating a new SA with LARVAL state.
3264 * key_api_add() and key_api_getspi() call,
3265 * and copy the values of mhp into new buffer.
3266 * When SAD message type is GETSPI:
3267 * to set sequence number from acq_seq++,
3268 * to set zero to SPI.
3269 * not to call key_setsaval().
3270 * OUT: NULL : fail
3271 * others : pointer to new secasvar.
3272 *
3273 * does not modify mbuf. does not free mbuf on error.
3274 */
3275static struct secasvar *
3276key_newsav(struct mbuf *m, const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp,
3277 int *errp, const char* where, int tag)
3278{
3279 struct secasvar *newsav;
3280 const struct sadb_sa *xsa;
3281
3282 KASSERT(!cpu_softintr_p());
3283 KASSERT(m != NULL);
3284 KASSERT(mhp != NULL);
3285 KASSERT(mhp->msg != NULL);
3286
3287 newsav = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(struct secasvar), KM_SLEEP);
3288
3289 switch (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_type) {
3290 case SADB_GETSPI:
3291 newsav->spi = 0;
3292
3293#ifdef IPSEC_DOSEQCHECK
3294 /* sync sequence number */
3295 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq == 0)
3296 newsav->seq =
3297 (acq_seq = (acq_seq == ~0 ? 1 : ++acq_seq));
3298 else
3299#endif
3300 newsav->seq = mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq;
3301 break;
3302
3303 case SADB_ADD:
3304 /* sanity check */
3305 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA] == NULL) {
3306 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
3307 *errp = EINVAL;
3308 goto error;
3309 }
3310 xsa = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA];
3311 newsav->spi = xsa->sadb_sa_spi;
3312 newsav->seq = mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq;
3313 break;
3314 default:
3315 *errp = EINVAL;
3316 goto error;
3317 }
3318
3319 /* copy sav values */
3320 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_type != SADB_GETSPI) {
3321 *errp = key_setsaval(newsav, m, mhp);
3322 if (*errp)
3323 goto error;
3324 } else {
3325 /* We don't allow lft_c to be NULL */
3326 newsav->lft_c = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime),
3327 KM_SLEEP);
3328 newsav->lft_c_counters_percpu =
3329 percpu_alloc(sizeof(lifetime_counters_t));
3330 }
3331
3332 /* reset created */
3333 newsav->created = time_uptime;
3334 newsav->pid = mhp->msg->sadb_msg_pid;
3335
3336 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_IPSEC_STAMP,
3337 "DP from %s:%u return SA:%p\n", where, tag, newsav);
3338 return newsav;
3339
3340error:
3341 KASSERT(*errp != 0);
3342 kmem_free(newsav, sizeof(*newsav));
3343 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_IPSEC_STAMP,
3344 "DP from %s:%u return SA:NULL\n", where, tag);
3345 return NULL;
3346}
3347
3348
3349static void
3350key_clear_xform(struct secasvar *sav)
3351{
3352
3353 /*
3354 * Cleanup xform state. Note that zeroize'ing causes the
3355 * keys to be cleared; otherwise we must do it ourself.
3356 */
3357 if (sav->tdb_xform != NULL) {
3358 sav->tdb_xform->xf_zeroize(sav);
3359 sav->tdb_xform = NULL;
3360 } else {
3361 if (sav->key_auth != NULL)
3362 explicit_memset(_KEYBUF(sav->key_auth), 0,
3363 _KEYLEN(sav->key_auth));
3364 if (sav->key_enc != NULL)
3365 explicit_memset(_KEYBUF(sav->key_enc), 0,
3366 _KEYLEN(sav->key_enc));
3367 }
3368}
3369
3370/*
3371 * free() SA variable entry.
3372 */
3373static void
3374key_delsav(struct secasvar *sav)
3375{
3376
3377 key_clear_xform(sav);
3378 key_freesaval(sav);
3379 kmem_free(sav, sizeof(*sav));
3380}
3381
3382/*
3383 * Must be called in a pserialize read section. A held sah
3384 * must be released by key_sah_unref after use.
3385 */
3386static void
3387key_sah_ref(struct secashead *sah)
3388{
3389
3390 localcount_acquire(&sah->localcount);
3391}
3392
3393/*
3394 * Must be called without holding key_sad.lock because the lock
3395 * would be held in localcount_release.
3396 */
3397static void
3398key_sah_unref(struct secashead *sah)
3399{
3400
3401 KDASSERT(mutex_ownable(&key_sad.lock));
3402
3403 localcount_release(&sah->localcount, &key_sad.cv_lc, &key_sad.lock);
3404}
3405
3406/*
3407 * Search SAD and return sah. Must be called in a pserialize
3408 * read section.
3409 * OUT:
3410 * NULL : not found
3411 * others : found, pointer to a SA.
3412 */
3413static struct secashead *
3414key_getsah(const struct secasindex *saidx, int flag)
3415{
3416 struct secashead *sah;
3417
3418 SAHLIST_READER_FOREACH_SAIDX(sah, saidx) {
3419 if (sah->state == SADB_SASTATE_DEAD)
3420 continue;
3421 if (key_saidx_match(&sah->saidx, saidx, flag))
3422 return sah;
3423 }
3424
3425 return NULL;
3426}
3427
3428/*
3429 * Search SAD and return sah. If sah is returned, the caller must call
3430 * key_sah_unref to releaset a reference.
3431 * OUT:
3432 * NULL : not found
3433 * others : found, pointer to a SA.
3434 */
3435static struct secashead *
3436key_getsah_ref(const struct secasindex *saidx, int flag)
3437{
3438 struct secashead *sah;
3439 int s;
3440
3441 s = pserialize_read_enter();
3442 sah = key_getsah(saidx, flag);
3443 if (sah != NULL)
3444 key_sah_ref(sah);
3445 pserialize_read_exit(s);
3446
3447 return sah;
3448}
3449
3450/*
3451 * check not to be duplicated SPI.
3452 * NOTE: this function is too slow due to searching all SAD.
3453 * OUT:
3454 * NULL : not found
3455 * others : found, pointer to a SA.
3456 */
3457static bool
3458key_checkspidup(const struct secasindex *saidx, u_int32_t spi)
3459{
3460 struct secashead *sah;
3461 struct secasvar *sav;
3462
3463 /* check address family */
3464 if (saidx->src.sa.sa_family != saidx->dst.sa.sa_family) {
3465 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
3466 "address family mismatched src %u, dst %u.\n",
3467 saidx->src.sa.sa_family, saidx->dst.sa.sa_family);
3468 return false;
3469 }
3470
3471 /* check all SAD */
3472 /* key_ismyaddr may sleep, so use mutex, not pserialize, here. */
3473 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
3474 SAHLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sah) {
3475 if (!key_ismyaddr((struct sockaddr *)&sah->saidx.dst))
3476 continue;
3477 sav = key_getsavbyspi(sah, spi);
3478 if (sav != NULL) {
3479 KEY_SA_UNREF(&sav);
3480 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
3481 return true;
3482 }
3483 }
3484 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
3485
3486 return false;
3487}
3488
3489/*
3490 * search SAD litmited alive SA, protocol, SPI.
3491 * OUT:
3492 * NULL : not found
3493 * others : found, pointer to a SA.
3494 */
3495static struct secasvar *
3496key_getsavbyspi(struct secashead *sah, u_int32_t spi)
3497{
3498 struct secasvar *sav = NULL;
3499 u_int state;
3500 int s;
3501
3502 /* search all status */
3503 s = pserialize_read_enter();
3504 SASTATE_ALIVE_FOREACH(state) {
3505 SAVLIST_READER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
3506 /* sanity check */
3507 if (sav->state != state) {
3508 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
3509 "invalid sav->state (queue: %d SA: %d)\n",
3510 state, sav->state);
3511 continue;
3512 }
3513
3514 if (sav->spi == spi) {
3515 KEY_SA_REF(sav);
3516 goto out;
3517 }
3518 }
3519 }
3520out:
3521 pserialize_read_exit(s);
3522
3523 return sav;
3524}
3525
3526/*
3527 * Search SAD litmited alive SA by an SPI and remove it from a list.
3528 * OUT:
3529 * NULL : not found
3530 * others : found, pointer to a SA.
3531 */
3532static struct secasvar *
3533key_lookup_and_remove_sav(struct secashead *sah, u_int32_t spi)
3534{
3535 struct secasvar *sav = NULL;
3536 u_int state;
3537
3538 /* search all status */
3539 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
3540 SASTATE_ALIVE_FOREACH(state) {
3541 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
3542 KASSERT(sav->state == state);
3543
3544 if (sav->spi == spi) {
3545 sav->state = SADB_SASTATE_DEAD;
3546 SAVLIST_WRITER_REMOVE(sav);
3547 SAVLUT_WRITER_REMOVE(sav);
3548 goto out;
3549 }
3550 }
3551 }
3552out:
3553 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
3554
3555 return sav;
3556}
3557
3558/*
3559 * Free allocated data to member variables of sav:
3560 * sav->replay, sav->key_* and sav->lft_*.
3561 */
3562static void
3563key_freesaval(struct secasvar *sav)
3564{
3565
3566 KASSERT(key_sa_refcnt(sav) == 0);
3567
3568 if (sav->replay != NULL)
3569 kmem_intr_free(sav->replay, sav->replay_len);
3570 if (sav->key_auth != NULL)
3571 kmem_intr_free(sav->key_auth, sav->key_auth_len);
3572 if (sav->key_enc != NULL)
3573 kmem_intr_free(sav->key_enc, sav->key_enc_len);
3574 if (sav->lft_c_counters_percpu != NULL) {
3575 percpu_free(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu,
3576 sizeof(lifetime_counters_t));
3577 }
3578 if (sav->lft_c != NULL)
3579 kmem_intr_free(sav->lft_c, sizeof(*(sav->lft_c)));
3580 if (sav->lft_h != NULL)
3581 kmem_intr_free(sav->lft_h, sizeof(*(sav->lft_h)));
3582 if (sav->lft_s != NULL)
3583 kmem_intr_free(sav->lft_s, sizeof(*(sav->lft_s)));
3584}
3585
3586/*
3587 * copy SA values from PF_KEY message except *SPI, SEQ, PID, STATE and TYPE*.
3588 * You must update these if need.
3589 * OUT: 0: success.
3590 * !0: failure.
3591 *
3592 * does not modify mbuf. does not free mbuf on error.
3593 */
3594static int
3595key_setsaval(struct secasvar *sav, struct mbuf *m,
3596 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
3597{
3598 int error = 0;
3599
3600 KASSERT(!cpu_softintr_p());
3601 KASSERT(m != NULL);
3602 KASSERT(mhp != NULL);
3603 KASSERT(mhp->msg != NULL);
3604
3605 /* We shouldn't initialize sav variables while someone uses it. */
3606 KASSERT(key_sa_refcnt(sav) == 0);
3607
3608 /* SA */
3609 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA] != NULL) {
3610 const struct sadb_sa *sa0;
3611
3612 sa0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA];
3613 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_SA] < sizeof(*sa0)) {
3614 error = EINVAL;
3615 goto fail;
3616 }
3617
3618 sav->alg_auth = sa0->sadb_sa_auth;
3619 sav->alg_enc = sa0->sadb_sa_encrypt;
3620 sav->flags = sa0->sadb_sa_flags;
3621
3622 /* replay window */
3623 if ((sa0->sadb_sa_flags & SADB_X_EXT_OLD) == 0) {
3624 size_t len = sizeof(struct secreplay) +
3625 sa0->sadb_sa_replay;
3626 sav->replay = kmem_zalloc(len, KM_SLEEP);
3627 sav->replay_len = len;
3628 if (sa0->sadb_sa_replay != 0)
3629 sav->replay->bitmap = (char*)(sav->replay+1);
3630 sav->replay->wsize = sa0->sadb_sa_replay;
3631 }
3632 }
3633
3634 /* Authentication keys */
3635 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH] != NULL) {
3636 const struct sadb_key *key0;
3637 int len;
3638
3639 key0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH];
3640 len = mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH];
3641
3642 error = 0;
3643 if (len < sizeof(*key0)) {
3644 error = EINVAL;
3645 goto fail;
3646 }
3647 switch (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype) {
3648 case SADB_SATYPE_AH:
3649 case SADB_SATYPE_ESP:
3650 case SADB_X_SATYPE_TCPSIGNATURE:
3651 if (len == PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_key)) &&
3652 sav->alg_auth != SADB_X_AALG_NULL)
3653 error = EINVAL;
3654 break;
3655 case SADB_X_SATYPE_IPCOMP:
3656 default:
3657 error = EINVAL;
3658 break;
3659 }
3660 if (error) {
3661 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid key_auth values.\n");
3662 goto fail;
3663 }
3664
3665 sav->key_auth = key_newbuf(key0, len);
3666 sav->key_auth_len = len;
3667 }
3668
3669 /* Encryption key */
3670 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT] != NULL) {
3671 const struct sadb_key *key0;
3672 int len;
3673
3674 key0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT];
3675 len = mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT];
3676
3677 error = 0;
3678 if (len < sizeof(*key0)) {
3679 error = EINVAL;
3680 goto fail;
3681 }
3682 switch (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype) {
3683 case SADB_SATYPE_ESP:
3684 if (len == PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_key)) &&
3685 sav->alg_enc != SADB_EALG_NULL) {
3686 error = EINVAL;
3687 break;
3688 }
3689 sav->key_enc = key_newbuf(key0, len);
3690 sav->key_enc_len = len;
3691 break;
3692 case SADB_X_SATYPE_IPCOMP:
3693 if (len != PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_key)))
3694 error = EINVAL;
3695 sav->key_enc = NULL; /*just in case*/
3696 break;
3697 case SADB_SATYPE_AH:
3698 case SADB_X_SATYPE_TCPSIGNATURE:
3699 default:
3700 error = EINVAL;
3701 break;
3702 }
3703 if (error) {
3704 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid key_enc value.\n");
3705 goto fail;
3706 }
3707 }
3708
3709 /* set iv */
3710 sav->ivlen = 0;
3711
3712 switch (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype) {
3713 case SADB_SATYPE_AH:
3714 error = xform_init(sav, XF_AH);
3715 break;
3716 case SADB_SATYPE_ESP:
3717 error = xform_init(sav, XF_ESP);
3718 break;
3719 case SADB_X_SATYPE_IPCOMP:
3720 error = xform_init(sav, XF_IPCOMP);
3721 break;
3722 case SADB_X_SATYPE_TCPSIGNATURE:
3723 error = xform_init(sav, XF_TCPSIGNATURE);
3724 break;
3725 default:
3726 error = EOPNOTSUPP;
3727 break;
3728 }
3729 if (error) {
3730 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "unable to initialize SA type %u (%d)\n",
3731 mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype, error);
3732 goto fail;
3733 }
3734
3735 /* reset created */
3736 sav->created = time_uptime;
3737
3738 /* make lifetime for CURRENT */
3739 sav->lft_c = kmem_alloc(sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime), KM_SLEEP);
3740
3741 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_len =
3742 PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime));
3743 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_exttype = SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_CURRENT;
3744 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_allocations = 0;
3745 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_bytes = 0;
3746 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_addtime = time_uptime;
3747 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_usetime = 0;
3748
3749 sav->lft_c_counters_percpu = percpu_alloc(sizeof(lifetime_counters_t));
3750
3751 /* lifetimes for HARD and SOFT */
3752 {
3753 const struct sadb_lifetime *lft0;
3754
3755 lft0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD];
3756 if (lft0 != NULL) {
3757 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD] < sizeof(*lft0)) {
3758 error = EINVAL;
3759 goto fail;
3760 }
3761 sav->lft_h = key_newbuf(lft0, sizeof(*lft0));
3762 }
3763
3764 lft0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT];
3765 if (lft0 != NULL) {
3766 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT] < sizeof(*lft0)) {
3767 error = EINVAL;
3768 goto fail;
3769 }
3770 sav->lft_s = key_newbuf(lft0, sizeof(*lft0));
3771 /* to be initialize ? */
3772 }
3773 }
3774
3775 return 0;
3776
3777 fail:
3778 key_clear_xform(sav);
3779 key_freesaval(sav);
3780
3781 return error;
3782}
3783
3784/*
3785 * validation with a secasvar entry, and set SADB_SATYPE_MATURE.
3786 * OUT: 0: valid
3787 * other: errno
3788 */
3789static int
3790key_init_xform(struct secasvar *sav)
3791{
3792 int error;
3793
3794 /* We shouldn't initialize sav variables while someone uses it. */
3795 KASSERT(key_sa_refcnt(sav) == 0);
3796
3797 /* check SPI value */
3798 switch (sav->sah->saidx.proto) {
3799 case IPPROTO_ESP:
3800 case IPPROTO_AH:
3801 if (ntohl(sav->spi) <= 255) {
3802 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "illegal range of SPI %u.\n",
3803 (u_int32_t)ntohl(sav->spi));
3804 return EINVAL;
3805 }
3806 break;
3807 }
3808
3809 /* check algo */
3810 switch (sav->sah->saidx.proto) {
3811 case IPPROTO_AH:
3812 case IPPROTO_TCP:
3813 if (sav->alg_enc != SADB_EALG_NONE) {
3814 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
3815 "protocol %u and algorithm mismatched %u != %u.\n",
3816 sav->sah->saidx.proto,
3817 sav->alg_enc, SADB_EALG_NONE);
3818 return EINVAL;
3819 }
3820 break;
3821 case IPPROTO_IPCOMP:
3822 if (sav->alg_auth != SADB_AALG_NONE) {
3823 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
3824 "protocol %u and algorithm mismatched %d != %d.\n",
3825 sav->sah->saidx.proto,
3826 sav->alg_auth, SADB_AALG_NONE);
3827 return(EINVAL);
3828 }
3829 break;
3830 default:
3831 break;
3832 }
3833
3834 /* check satype */
3835 switch (sav->sah->saidx.proto) {
3836 case IPPROTO_ESP:
3837 /* check flags */
3838 if ((sav->flags & (SADB_X_EXT_OLD|SADB_X_EXT_DERIV)) ==
3839 (SADB_X_EXT_OLD|SADB_X_EXT_DERIV)) {
3840 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
3841 "invalid flag (derived) given to old-esp.\n");
3842 return EINVAL;
3843 }
3844 error = xform_init(sav, XF_ESP);
3845 break;
3846 case IPPROTO_AH:
3847 /* check flags */
3848 if (sav->flags & SADB_X_EXT_DERIV) {
3849 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
3850 "invalid flag (derived) given to AH SA.\n");
3851 return EINVAL;
3852 }
3853 error = xform_init(sav, XF_AH);
3854 break;
3855 case IPPROTO_IPCOMP:
3856 if ((sav->flags & SADB_X_EXT_RAWCPI) == 0
3857 && ntohl(sav->spi) >= 0x10000) {
3858 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid cpi for IPComp.\n");
3859 return(EINVAL);
3860 }
3861 error = xform_init(sav, XF_IPCOMP);
3862 break;
3863 case IPPROTO_TCP:
3864 error = xform_init(sav, XF_TCPSIGNATURE);
3865 break;
3866 default:
3867 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "Invalid satype.\n");
3868 error = EPROTONOSUPPORT;
3869 break;
3870 }
3871
3872 return error;
3873}
3874
3875/*
3876 * subroutine for SADB_GET and SADB_DUMP. It never return NULL.
3877 */
3878static struct mbuf *
3879key_setdumpsa(struct secasvar *sav, u_int8_t type, u_int8_t satype,
3880 u_int32_t seq, u_int32_t pid)
3881{
3882 struct mbuf *result = NULL, *tres = NULL, *m;
3883 int l = 0;
3884 int i;
3885 void *p;
3886 struct sadb_lifetime lt;
3887 int dumporder[] = {
3888 SADB_EXT_SA, SADB_X_EXT_SA2,
3889 SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD, SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT,
3890 SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_CURRENT, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC,
3891 SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_PROXY, SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH,
3892 SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT, SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC,
3893 SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST, SADB_EXT_SENSITIVITY,
3894 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE,
3895 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT, SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT,
3896 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI, SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR,
3897 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG,
3898
3899 };
3900
3901 m = key_setsadbmsg(type, 0, satype, seq, pid, key_sa_refcnt(sav), M_WAITOK);
3902 result = m;
3903
3904 for (i = __arraycount(dumporder) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
3905 m = NULL;
3906 p = NULL;
3907 switch (dumporder[i]) {
3908 case SADB_EXT_SA:
3909 m = key_setsadbsa(sav);
3910 break;
3911
3912 case SADB_X_EXT_SA2:
3913 m = key_setsadbxsa2(sav->sah->saidx.mode,
3914 sav->replay ? sav->replay->count : 0,
3915 sav->sah->saidx.reqid);
3916 break;
3917
3918 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC:
3919 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC,
3920 &sav->sah->saidx.src.sa,
3921 FULLMASK, IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, M_WAITOK);
3922 break;
3923
3924 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST:
3925 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST,
3926 &sav->sah->saidx.dst.sa,
3927 FULLMASK, IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, M_WAITOK);
3928 break;
3929
3930 case SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH:
3931 if (!sav->key_auth)
3932 continue;
3933 l = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(sav->key_auth->sadb_key_len);
3934 p = sav->key_auth;
3935 break;
3936
3937 case SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT:
3938 if (!sav->key_enc)
3939 continue;
3940 l = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(sav->key_enc->sadb_key_len);
3941 p = sav->key_enc;
3942 break;
3943
3944 case SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_CURRENT: {
3945 lifetime_counters_t sum = {0};
3946
3947 KASSERT(sav->lft_c != NULL);
3948 l = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(((struct sadb_ext *)sav->lft_c)->sadb_ext_len);
3949 memcpy(&lt, sav->lft_c, sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime));
3950 lt.sadb_lifetime_addtime =
3951 time_mono_to_wall(lt.sadb_lifetime_addtime);
3952 lt.sadb_lifetime_usetime =
3953 time_mono_to_wall(lt.sadb_lifetime_usetime);
3954 percpu_foreach(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu,
3955 key_sum_lifetime_counters, sum);
3956 lt.sadb_lifetime_allocations =
3957 sum[LIFETIME_COUNTER_ALLOCATIONS];
3958 lt.sadb_lifetime_bytes =
3959 sum[LIFETIME_COUNTER_BYTES];
3960 p = &lt;
3961 break;
3962 }
3963
3964 case SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD:
3965 if (!sav->lft_h)
3966 continue;
3967 l = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(((struct sadb_ext *)sav->lft_h)->sadb_ext_len);
3968 p = sav->lft_h;
3969 break;
3970
3971 case SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT:
3972 if (!sav->lft_s)
3973 continue;
3974 l = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(((struct sadb_ext *)sav->lft_s)->sadb_ext_len);
3975 p = sav->lft_s;
3976 break;
3977
3978 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE:
3979 m = key_setsadbxtype(sav->natt_type);
3980 break;
3981
3982 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT:
3983 if (sav->natt_type == 0)
3984 continue;
3985 m = key_setsadbxport(
3986 key_portfromsaddr(&sav->sah->saidx.dst),
3987 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT);
3988 break;
3989
3990 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT:
3991 if (sav->natt_type == 0)
3992 continue;
3993 m = key_setsadbxport(
3994 key_portfromsaddr(&sav->sah->saidx.src),
3995 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT);
3996 break;
3997
3998 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG:
3999 /* don't send frag info if not set */
4000 if (sav->natt_type == 0 || sav->esp_frag == IP_MAXPACKET)
4001 continue;
4002 m = key_setsadbxfrag(sav->esp_frag);
4003 break;
4004
4005 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI:
4006 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR:
4007 continue;
4008
4009 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_PROXY:
4010 case SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC:
4011 case SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST:
4012 /* XXX: should we brought from SPD ? */
4013 case SADB_EXT_SENSITIVITY:
4014 default:
4015 continue;
4016 }
4017
4018 KASSERT(!(m && p));
4019 KASSERT(m != NULL || p != NULL);
4020 if (p && tres) {
4021 M_PREPEND(tres, l, M_WAITOK);
4022 memcpy(mtod(tres, void *), p, l);
4023 continue;
4024 }
4025 if (p) {
4026 m = key_alloc_mbuf(l, M_WAITOK);
4027 m_copyback(m, 0, l, p);
4028 }
4029
4030 if (tres)
4031 m_cat(m, tres);
4032 tres = m;
4033 }
4034
4035 m_cat(result, tres);
4036 tres = NULL; /* avoid free on error below */
4037
4038 KASSERT(result->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
4039
4040 result->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
4041 for (m = result; m; m = m->m_next)
4042 result->m_pkthdr.len += m->m_len;
4043
4044 mtod(result, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_len =
4045 PFKEY_UNIT64(result->m_pkthdr.len);
4046
4047 return result;
4048}
4049
4050
4051/*
4052 * set a type in sadb_x_nat_t_type
4053 */
4054static struct mbuf *
4055key_setsadbxtype(u_int16_t type)
4056{
4057 struct mbuf *m;
4058 size_t len;
4059 struct sadb_x_nat_t_type *p;
4060
4061 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_x_nat_t_type));
4062
4063 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
4064 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
4065
4066 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_x_nat_t_type *);
4067
4068 memset(p, 0, len);
4069 p->sadb_x_nat_t_type_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4070 p->sadb_x_nat_t_type_exttype = SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE;
4071 p->sadb_x_nat_t_type_type = type;
4072
4073 return m;
4074}
4075/*
4076 * set a port in sadb_x_nat_t_port. port is in network order
4077 */
4078static struct mbuf *
4079key_setsadbxport(u_int16_t port, u_int16_t type)
4080{
4081 struct mbuf *m;
4082 size_t len;
4083 struct sadb_x_nat_t_port *p;
4084
4085 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_x_nat_t_port));
4086
4087 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
4088 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
4089
4090 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_x_nat_t_port *);
4091
4092 memset(p, 0, len);
4093 p->sadb_x_nat_t_port_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4094 p->sadb_x_nat_t_port_exttype = type;
4095 p->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port = port;
4096
4097 return m;
4098}
4099
4100/*
4101 * set fragmentation info in sadb_x_nat_t_frag
4102 */
4103static struct mbuf *
4104key_setsadbxfrag(u_int16_t flen)
4105{
4106 struct mbuf *m;
4107 size_t len;
4108 struct sadb_x_nat_t_frag *p;
4109
4110 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_x_nat_t_frag));
4111
4112 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
4113 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
4114
4115 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_x_nat_t_frag *);
4116
4117 memset(p, 0, len);
4118 p->sadb_x_nat_t_frag_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4119 p->sadb_x_nat_t_frag_exttype = SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG;
4120 p->sadb_x_nat_t_frag_fraglen = flen;
4121
4122 return m;
4123}
4124
4125/*
4126 * Get port from sockaddr, port is in network order
4127 */
4128u_int16_t
4129key_portfromsaddr(const union sockaddr_union *saddr)
4130{
4131 u_int16_t port;
4132
4133 switch (saddr->sa.sa_family) {
4134 case AF_INET: {
4135 port = saddr->sin.sin_port;
4136 break;
4137 }
4138#ifdef INET6
4139 case AF_INET6: {
4140 port = saddr->sin6.sin6_port;
4141 break;
4142 }
4143#endif
4144 default:
4145 printf("%s: unexpected address family\n", __func__);
4146 port = 0;
4147 break;
4148 }
4149
4150 return port;
4151}
4152
4153
4154/*
4155 * Set port is struct sockaddr. port is in network order
4156 */
4157static void
4158key_porttosaddr(union sockaddr_union *saddr, u_int16_t port)
4159{
4160 switch (saddr->sa.sa_family) {
4161 case AF_INET: {
4162 saddr->sin.sin_port = port;
4163 break;
4164 }
4165#ifdef INET6
4166 case AF_INET6: {
4167 saddr->sin6.sin6_port = port;
4168 break;
4169 }
4170#endif
4171 default:
4172 printf("%s: unexpected address family %d\n", __func__,
4173 saddr->sa.sa_family);
4174 break;
4175 }
4176
4177 return;
4178}
4179
4180/*
4181 * Safety check sa_len
4182 */
4183static int
4184key_checksalen(const union sockaddr_union *saddr)
4185{
4186 switch (saddr->sa.sa_family) {
4187 case AF_INET:
4188 if (saddr->sa.sa_len != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in))
4189 return -1;
4190 break;
4191#ifdef INET6
4192 case AF_INET6:
4193 if (saddr->sa.sa_len != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6))
4194 return -1;
4195 break;
4196#endif
4197 default:
4198 printf("%s: unexpected sa_family %d\n", __func__,
4199 saddr->sa.sa_family);
4200 return -1;
4201 break;
4202 }
4203 return 0;
4204}
4205
4206
4207/*
4208 * set data into sadb_msg.
4209 */
4210static struct mbuf *
4211key_setsadbmsg(u_int8_t type, u_int16_t tlen, u_int8_t satype,
4212 u_int32_t seq, pid_t pid, u_int16_t reserved, int mflag)
4213{
4214 struct mbuf *m;
4215 struct sadb_msg *p;
4216 int len;
4217
4218 CTASSERT(PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) <= MCLBYTES);
4219
4220 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
4221
4222 m = key_alloc_mbuf_simple(len, mflag);
4223 if (!m)
4224 return NULL;
4225 m->m_pkthdr.len = m->m_len = len;
4226 m->m_next = NULL;
4227
4228 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_msg *);
4229
4230 memset(p, 0, len);
4231 p->sadb_msg_version = PF_KEY_V2;
4232 p->sadb_msg_type = type;
4233 p->sadb_msg_errno = 0;
4234 p->sadb_msg_satype = satype;
4235 p->sadb_msg_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(tlen);
4236 p->sadb_msg_reserved = reserved;
4237 p->sadb_msg_seq = seq;
4238 p->sadb_msg_pid = (u_int32_t)pid;
4239
4240 return m;
4241}
4242
4243/*
4244 * copy secasvar data into sadb_address.
4245 */
4246static struct mbuf *
4247key_setsadbsa(struct secasvar *sav)
4248{
4249 struct mbuf *m;
4250 struct sadb_sa *p;
4251 int len;
4252
4253 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_sa));
4254 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
4255 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
4256
4257 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_sa *);
4258
4259 memset(p, 0, len);
4260 p->sadb_sa_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4261 p->sadb_sa_exttype = SADB_EXT_SA;
4262 p->sadb_sa_spi = sav->spi;
4263 p->sadb_sa_replay = (sav->replay != NULL ? sav->replay->wsize : 0);
4264 p->sadb_sa_state = sav->state;
4265 p->sadb_sa_auth = sav->alg_auth;
4266 p->sadb_sa_encrypt = sav->alg_enc;
4267 p->sadb_sa_flags = sav->flags;
4268
4269 return m;
4270}
4271
4272static uint8_t
4273key_sabits(const struct sockaddr *saddr)
4274{
4275 switch (saddr->sa_family) {
4276 case AF_INET:
4277 return _BITS(sizeof(struct in_addr));
4278 case AF_INET6:
4279 return _BITS(sizeof(struct in6_addr));
4280 default:
4281 return FULLMASK;
4282 }
4283}
4284
4285/*
4286 * set data into sadb_address.
4287 */
4288static struct mbuf *
4289key_setsadbaddr(u_int16_t exttype, const struct sockaddr *saddr,
4290 u_int8_t prefixlen, u_int16_t ul_proto, int mflag)
4291{
4292 struct mbuf *m;
4293 struct sadb_address *p;
4294 size_t len;
4295
4296 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_address)) +
4297 PFKEY_ALIGN8(saddr->sa_len);
4298 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, mflag);
4299 if (!m || m->m_next) { /*XXX*/
4300 if (m)
4301 m_freem(m);
4302 return NULL;
4303 }
4304
4305 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_address *);
4306
4307 memset(p, 0, len);
4308 p->sadb_address_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4309 p->sadb_address_exttype = exttype;
4310 p->sadb_address_proto = ul_proto;
4311 if (prefixlen == FULLMASK) {
4312 prefixlen = key_sabits(saddr);
4313 }
4314 p->sadb_address_prefixlen = prefixlen;
4315 p->sadb_address_reserved = 0;
4316
4317 memcpy(mtod(m, char *) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_address)),
4318 saddr, saddr->sa_len);
4319
4320 return m;
4321}
4322
4323#if 0
4324/*
4325 * set data into sadb_ident.
4326 */
4327static struct mbuf *
4328key_setsadbident(u_int16_t exttype, u_int16_t idtype,
4329 void *string, int stringlen, u_int64_t id)
4330{
4331 struct mbuf *m;
4332 struct sadb_ident *p;
4333 size_t len;
4334
4335 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_ident)) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(stringlen);
4336 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len);
4337 if (!m || m->m_next) { /*XXX*/
4338 if (m)
4339 m_freem(m);
4340 return NULL;
4341 }
4342
4343 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_ident *);
4344
4345 memset(p, 0, len);
4346 p->sadb_ident_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4347 p->sadb_ident_exttype = exttype;
4348 p->sadb_ident_type = idtype;
4349 p->sadb_ident_reserved = 0;
4350 p->sadb_ident_id = id;
4351
4352 memcpy(mtod(m, void *) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_ident)),
4353 string, stringlen);
4354
4355 return m;
4356}
4357#endif
4358
4359/*
4360 * set data into sadb_x_sa2.
4361 */
4362static struct mbuf *
4363key_setsadbxsa2(u_int8_t mode, u_int32_t seq, u_int16_t reqid)
4364{
4365 struct mbuf *m;
4366 struct sadb_x_sa2 *p;
4367 size_t len;
4368
4369 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_x_sa2));
4370 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
4371 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
4372
4373 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_x_sa2 *);
4374
4375 memset(p, 0, len);
4376 p->sadb_x_sa2_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4377 p->sadb_x_sa2_exttype = SADB_X_EXT_SA2;
4378 p->sadb_x_sa2_mode = mode;
4379 p->sadb_x_sa2_reserved1 = 0;
4380 p->sadb_x_sa2_reserved2 = 0;
4381 p->sadb_x_sa2_sequence = seq;
4382 p->sadb_x_sa2_reqid = reqid;
4383
4384 return m;
4385}
4386
4387/*
4388 * set data into sadb_x_policy
4389 */
4390static struct mbuf *
4391key_setsadbxpolicy(const u_int16_t type, const u_int8_t dir, const u_int32_t id,
4392 int mflag)
4393{
4394 struct mbuf *m;
4395 struct sadb_x_policy *p;
4396 size_t len;
4397
4398 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_x_policy));
4399 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, mflag);
4400 if (!m || m->m_next) { /*XXX*/
4401 if (m)
4402 m_freem(m);
4403 return NULL;
4404 }
4405
4406 p = mtod(m, struct sadb_x_policy *);
4407
4408 memset(p, 0, len);
4409 p->sadb_x_policy_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(len);
4410 p->sadb_x_policy_exttype = SADB_X_EXT_POLICY;
4411 p->sadb_x_policy_type = type;
4412 p->sadb_x_policy_dir = dir;
4413 p->sadb_x_policy_id = id;
4414
4415 return m;
4416}
4417
4418/* %%% utilities */
4419/*
4420 * copy a buffer into the new buffer allocated.
4421 */
4422static void *
4423key_newbuf(const void *src, u_int len)
4424{
4425 void *new;
4426
4427 new = kmem_alloc(len, KM_SLEEP);
4428 memcpy(new, src, len);
4429
4430 return new;
4431}
4432
4433/* compare my own address
4434 * OUT: 1: true, i.e. my address.
4435 * 0: false
4436 */
4437int
4438key_ismyaddr(const struct sockaddr *sa)
4439{
4440#ifdef INET
4441 const struct sockaddr_in *sin;
4442 const struct in_ifaddr *ia;
4443 int s;
4444#endif
4445
4446 KASSERT(sa != NULL);
4447
4448 switch (sa->sa_family) {
4449#ifdef INET
4450 case AF_INET:
4451 sin = (const struct sockaddr_in *)sa;
4452 s = pserialize_read_enter();
4453 IN_ADDRLIST_READER_FOREACH(ia) {
4454 if (sin->sin_family == ia->ia_addr.sin_family &&
4455 sin->sin_len == ia->ia_addr.sin_len &&
4456 sin->sin_addr.s_addr == ia->ia_addr.sin_addr.s_addr)
4457 {
4458 pserialize_read_exit(s);
4459 return 1;
4460 }
4461 }
4462 pserialize_read_exit(s);
4463 break;
4464#endif
4465#ifdef INET6
4466 case AF_INET6:
4467 return key_ismyaddr6((const struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa);
4468#endif
4469 }
4470
4471 return 0;
4472}
4473
4474#ifdef INET6
4475/*
4476 * compare my own address for IPv6.
4477 * 1: ours
4478 * 0: other
4479 * NOTE: derived ip6_input() in KAME. This is necessary to modify more.
4480 */
4481#include <netinet6/in6_var.h>
4482
4483static int
4484key_ismyaddr6(const struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6)
4485{
4486 struct in6_ifaddr *ia;
4487 int s;
4488 struct psref psref;
4489 int bound;
4490 int ours = 1;
4491
4492 bound = curlwp_bind();
4493 s = pserialize_read_enter();
4494 IN6_ADDRLIST_READER_FOREACH(ia) {
4495 bool ingroup;
4496
4497 if (key_sockaddr_match((const struct sockaddr *)&sin6,
4498 (const struct sockaddr *)&ia->ia_addr, 0)) {
4499 pserialize_read_exit(s);
4500 goto ours;
4501 }
4502 ia6_acquire(ia, &psref);
4503 pserialize_read_exit(s);
4504
4505 /*
4506 * XXX Multicast
4507 * XXX why do we care about multlicast here while we don't care
4508 * about IPv4 multicast??
4509 * XXX scope
4510 */
4511 ingroup = in6_multi_group(&sin6->sin6_addr, ia->ia_ifp);
4512 if (ingroup) {
4513 ia6_release(ia, &psref);
4514 goto ours;
4515 }
4516
4517 s = pserialize_read_enter();
4518 ia6_release(ia, &psref);
4519 }
4520 pserialize_read_exit(s);
4521
4522 /* loopback, just for safety */
4523 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LOOPBACK(&sin6->sin6_addr))
4524 goto ours;
4525
4526 ours = 0;
4527ours:
4528 curlwp_bindx(bound);
4529
4530 return ours;
4531}
4532#endif /*INET6*/
4533
4534/*
4535 * compare two secasindex structure.
4536 * flag can specify to compare 2 saidxes.
4537 * compare two secasindex structure without both mode and reqid.
4538 * don't compare port.
4539 * IN:
4540 * saidx0: source, it can be in SAD.
4541 * saidx1: object.
4542 * OUT:
4543 * 1 : equal
4544 * 0 : not equal
4545 */
4546static int
4547key_saidx_match(
4548 const struct secasindex *saidx0,
4549 const struct secasindex *saidx1,
4550 int flag)
4551{
4552 int chkport;
4553 const struct sockaddr *sa0src, *sa0dst, *sa1src, *sa1dst;
4554
4555 KASSERT(saidx0 != NULL);
4556 KASSERT(saidx1 != NULL);
4557
4558 /* sanity */
4559 if (saidx0->proto != saidx1->proto)
4560 return 0;
4561
4562 if (flag == CMP_EXACTLY) {
4563 if (saidx0->mode != saidx1->mode)
4564 return 0;
4565 if (saidx0->reqid != saidx1->reqid)
4566 return 0;
4567 if (memcmp(&saidx0->src, &saidx1->src, saidx0->src.sa.sa_len) != 0 ||
4568 memcmp(&saidx0->dst, &saidx1->dst, saidx0->dst.sa.sa_len) != 0)
4569 return 0;
4570 } else {
4571
4572 /* CMP_MODE_REQID, CMP_REQID, CMP_HEAD */
4573 if (flag == CMP_MODE_REQID ||flag == CMP_REQID) {
4574 /*
4575 * If reqid of SPD is non-zero, unique SA is required.
4576 * The result must be of same reqid in this case.
4577 */
4578 if (saidx1->reqid != 0 && saidx0->reqid != saidx1->reqid)
4579 return 0;
4580 }
4581
4582 if (flag == CMP_MODE_REQID) {
4583 if (saidx0->mode != IPSEC_MODE_ANY &&
4584 saidx0->mode != saidx1->mode)
4585 return 0;
4586 }
4587
4588
4589 sa0src = &saidx0->src.sa;
4590 sa0dst = &saidx0->dst.sa;
4591 sa1src = &saidx1->src.sa;
4592 sa1dst = &saidx1->dst.sa;
4593 /*
4594 * If NAT-T is enabled, check ports for tunnel mode.
4595 * For ipsecif(4), check ports for transport mode, too.
4596 * Don't check ports if they are set to zero
4597 * in the SPD: This means we have a non-generated
4598 * SPD which can't know UDP ports.
4599 */
4600 if (saidx1->mode == IPSEC_MODE_TUNNEL ||
4601 saidx1->mode == IPSEC_MODE_TRANSPORT)
4602 chkport = PORT_LOOSE;
4603 else
4604 chkport = PORT_NONE;
4605
4606 if (!key_sockaddr_match(sa0src, sa1src, chkport)) {
4607 return 0;
4608 }
4609 if (!key_sockaddr_match(sa0dst, sa1dst, chkport)) {
4610 return 0;
4611 }
4612 }
4613
4614 return 1;
4615}
4616
4617/*
4618 * compare two secindex structure exactly.
4619 * IN:
4620 * spidx0: source, it is often in SPD.
4621 * spidx1: object, it is often from PFKEY message.
4622 * OUT:
4623 * 1 : equal
4624 * 0 : not equal
4625 */
4626static int
4627key_spidx_match_exactly(
4628 const struct secpolicyindex *spidx0,
4629 const struct secpolicyindex *spidx1)
4630{
4631
4632 KASSERT(spidx0 != NULL);
4633 KASSERT(spidx1 != NULL);
4634
4635 /* sanity */
4636 if (spidx0->prefs != spidx1->prefs ||
4637 spidx0->prefd != spidx1->prefd ||
4638 spidx0->ul_proto != spidx1->ul_proto)
4639 return 0;
4640
4641 return key_sockaddr_match(&spidx0->src.sa, &spidx1->src.sa, PORT_STRICT) &&
4642 key_sockaddr_match(&spidx0->dst.sa, &spidx1->dst.sa, PORT_STRICT);
4643}
4644
4645/*
4646 * compare two secindex structure with mask.
4647 * IN:
4648 * spidx0: source, it is often in SPD.
4649 * spidx1: object, it is often from IP header.
4650 * OUT:
4651 * 1 : equal
4652 * 0 : not equal
4653 */
4654static int
4655key_spidx_match_withmask(
4656 const struct secpolicyindex *spidx0,
4657 const struct secpolicyindex *spidx1)
4658{
4659
4660 KASSERT(spidx0 != NULL);
4661 KASSERT(spidx1 != NULL);
4662
4663 if (spidx0->src.sa.sa_family != spidx1->src.sa.sa_family ||
4664 spidx0->dst.sa.sa_family != spidx1->dst.sa.sa_family ||
4665 spidx0->src.sa.sa_len != spidx1->src.sa.sa_len ||
4666 spidx0->dst.sa.sa_len != spidx1->dst.sa.sa_len)
4667 return 0;
4668
4669 /* if spidx.ul_proto == IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, ignore. */
4670 if (spidx0->ul_proto != (u_int16_t)IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY &&
4671 spidx0->ul_proto != spidx1->ul_proto)
4672 return 0;
4673
4674 switch (spidx0->src.sa.sa_family) {
4675 case AF_INET:
4676 if (spidx0->src.sin.sin_port != IPSEC_PORT_ANY &&
4677 spidx0->src.sin.sin_port != spidx1->src.sin.sin_port)
4678 return 0;
4679 if (!key_bb_match_withmask(&spidx0->src.sin.sin_addr,
4680 &spidx1->src.sin.sin_addr, spidx0->prefs))
4681 return 0;
4682 break;
4683 case AF_INET6:
4684 if (spidx0->src.sin6.sin6_port != IPSEC_PORT_ANY &&
4685 spidx0->src.sin6.sin6_port != spidx1->src.sin6.sin6_port)
4686 return 0;
4687 /*
4688 * scope_id check. if sin6_scope_id is 0, we regard it
4689 * as a wildcard scope, which matches any scope zone ID.
4690 */
4691 if (spidx0->src.sin6.sin6_scope_id &&
4692 spidx1->src.sin6.sin6_scope_id &&
4693 spidx0->src.sin6.sin6_scope_id != spidx1->src.sin6.sin6_scope_id)
4694 return 0;
4695 if (!key_bb_match_withmask(&spidx0->src.sin6.sin6_addr,
4696 &spidx1->src.sin6.sin6_addr, spidx0->prefs))
4697 return 0;
4698 break;
4699 default:
4700 /* XXX */
4701 if (memcmp(&spidx0->src, &spidx1->src, spidx0->src.sa.sa_len) != 0)
4702 return 0;
4703 break;
4704 }
4705
4706 switch (spidx0->dst.sa.sa_family) {
4707 case AF_INET:
4708 if (spidx0->dst.sin.sin_port != IPSEC_PORT_ANY &&
4709 spidx0->dst.sin.sin_port != spidx1->dst.sin.sin_port)
4710 return 0;
4711 if (!key_bb_match_withmask(&spidx0->dst.sin.sin_addr,
4712 &spidx1->dst.sin.sin_addr, spidx0->prefd))
4713 return 0;
4714 break;
4715 case AF_INET6:
4716 if (spidx0->dst.sin6.sin6_port != IPSEC_PORT_ANY &&
4717 spidx0->dst.sin6.sin6_port != spidx1->dst.sin6.sin6_port)
4718 return 0;
4719 /*
4720 * scope_id check. if sin6_scope_id is 0, we regard it
4721 * as a wildcard scope, which matches any scope zone ID.
4722 */
4723 if (spidx0->src.sin6.sin6_scope_id &&
4724 spidx1->src.sin6.sin6_scope_id &&
4725 spidx0->dst.sin6.sin6_scope_id != spidx1->dst.sin6.sin6_scope_id)
4726 return 0;
4727 if (!key_bb_match_withmask(&spidx0->dst.sin6.sin6_addr,
4728 &spidx1->dst.sin6.sin6_addr, spidx0->prefd))
4729 return 0;
4730 break;
4731 default:
4732 /* XXX */
4733 if (memcmp(&spidx0->dst, &spidx1->dst, spidx0->dst.sa.sa_len) != 0)
4734 return 0;
4735 break;
4736 }
4737
4738 /* XXX Do we check other field ? e.g. flowinfo */
4739
4740 return 1;
4741}
4742
4743/* returns 0 on match */
4744static int
4745key_portcomp(in_port_t port1, in_port_t port2, int howport)
4746{
4747 switch (howport) {
4748 case PORT_NONE:
4749 return 0;
4750 case PORT_LOOSE:
4751 if (port1 == 0 || port2 == 0)
4752 return 0;
4753 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
4754 case PORT_STRICT:
4755 if (port1 != port2) {
4756 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_MATCH,
4757 "port fail %d != %d\n", port1, port2);
4758 return 1;
4759 }
4760 return 0;
4761 default:
4762 KASSERT(0);
4763 return 1;
4764 }
4765}
4766
4767/* returns 1 on match */
4768static int
4769key_sockaddr_match(
4770 const struct sockaddr *sa1,
4771 const struct sockaddr *sa2,
4772 int howport)
4773{
4774 const struct sockaddr_in *sin1, *sin2;
4775 const struct sockaddr_in6 *sin61, *sin62;
4776 char s1[IPSEC_ADDRSTRLEN], s2[IPSEC_ADDRSTRLEN];
4777
4778 if (sa1->sa_family != sa2->sa_family || sa1->sa_len != sa2->sa_len) {
4779 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_MATCH,
4780 "fam/len fail %d != %d || %d != %d\n",
4781 sa1->sa_family, sa2->sa_family, sa1->sa_len,
4782 sa2->sa_len);
4783 return 0;
4784 }
4785
4786 switch (sa1->sa_family) {
4787 case AF_INET:
4788 if (sa1->sa_len != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) {
4789 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_MATCH,
4790 "len fail %d != %zu\n",
4791 sa1->sa_len, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
4792 return 0;
4793 }
4794 sin1 = (const struct sockaddr_in *)sa1;
4795 sin2 = (const struct sockaddr_in *)sa2;
4796 if (sin1->sin_addr.s_addr != sin2->sin_addr.s_addr) {
4797 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_MATCH,
4798 "addr fail %s != %s\n",
4799 (in_print(s1, sizeof(s1), &sin1->sin_addr), s1),
4800 (in_print(s2, sizeof(s2), &sin2->sin_addr), s2));
4801 return 0;
4802 }
4803 if (key_portcomp(sin1->sin_port, sin2->sin_port, howport)) {
4804 return 0;
4805 }
4806 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_MATCH,
4807 "addr success %s[%d] == %s[%d]\n",
4808 (in_print(s1, sizeof(s1), &sin1->sin_addr), s1),
4809 sin1->sin_port,
4810 (in_print(s2, sizeof(s2), &sin2->sin_addr), s2),
4811 sin2->sin_port);
4812 break;
4813 case AF_INET6:
4814 sin61 = (const struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa1;
4815 sin62 = (const struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa2;
4816 if (sa1->sa_len != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6))
4817 return 0; /*EINVAL*/
4818
4819 if (sin61->sin6_scope_id != sin62->sin6_scope_id) {
4820 return 0;
4821 }
4822 if (!IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&sin61->sin6_addr, &sin62->sin6_addr)) {
4823 return 0;
4824 }
4825 if (key_portcomp(sin61->sin6_port, sin62->sin6_port, howport)) {
4826 return 0;
4827 }
4828 break;
4829 default:
4830 if (memcmp(sa1, sa2, sa1->sa_len) != 0)
4831 return 0;
4832 break;
4833 }
4834
4835 return 1;
4836}
4837
4838/*
4839 * compare two buffers with mask.
4840 * IN:
4841 * addr1: source
4842 * addr2: object
4843 * bits: Number of bits to compare
4844 * OUT:
4845 * 1 : equal
4846 * 0 : not equal
4847 */
4848static int
4849key_bb_match_withmask(const void *a1, const void *a2, u_int bits)
4850{
4851 const unsigned char *p1 = a1;
4852 const unsigned char *p2 = a2;
4853
4854 /* XXX: This could be considerably faster if we compare a word
4855 * at a time, but it is complicated on LSB Endian machines */
4856
4857 /* Handle null pointers */
4858 if (p1 == NULL || p2 == NULL)
4859 return (p1 == p2);
4860
4861 while (bits >= 8) {
4862 if (*p1++ != *p2++)
4863 return 0;
4864 bits -= 8;
4865 }
4866
4867 if (bits > 0) {
4868 u_int8_t mask = ~((1<<(8-bits))-1);
4869 if ((*p1 & mask) != (*p2 & mask))
4870 return 0;
4871 }
4872 return 1; /* Match! */
4873}
4874
4875static void
4876key_timehandler_spd(time_t now)
4877{
4878 u_int dir;
4879 struct secpolicy *sp;
4880
4881 for (dir = 0; dir < IPSEC_DIR_MAX; dir++) {
4882 retry:
4883 mutex_enter(&key_spd.lock);
4884 SPLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sp, dir) {
4885 KASSERT(sp->state != IPSEC_SPSTATE_DEAD);
4886
4887 if (sp->lifetime == 0 && sp->validtime == 0)
4888 continue;
4889
4890 if ((sp->lifetime && now - sp->created > sp->lifetime) ||
4891 (sp->validtime && now - sp->lastused > sp->validtime)) {
4892 key_unlink_sp(sp);
4893 mutex_exit(&key_spd.lock);
4894 key_spdexpire(sp);
4895 key_destroy_sp(sp);
4896 goto retry;
4897 }
4898 }
4899 mutex_exit(&key_spd.lock);
4900 }
4901
4902 retry_socksplist:
4903 mutex_enter(&key_spd.lock);
4904 SOCKSPLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sp) {
4905 if (sp->state != IPSEC_SPSTATE_DEAD)
4906 continue;
4907
4908 key_unlink_sp(sp);
4909 mutex_exit(&key_spd.lock);
4910 key_destroy_sp(sp);
4911 goto retry_socksplist;
4912 }
4913 mutex_exit(&key_spd.lock);
4914}
4915
4916static void
4917key_timehandler_sad(time_t now)
4918{
4919 struct secashead *sah;
4920 int s;
4921
4922restart:
4923 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
4924 SAHLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sah) {
4925 /* If sah has been dead and has no sav, then delete it */
4926 if (sah->state == SADB_SASTATE_DEAD &&
4927 !key_sah_has_sav(sah)) {
4928 key_unlink_sah(sah);
4929 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
4930 key_destroy_sah(sah);
4931 goto restart;
4932 }
4933 }
4934 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
4935
4936 s = pserialize_read_enter();
4937 SAHLIST_READER_FOREACH(sah) {
4938 struct secasvar *sav;
4939
4940 key_sah_ref(sah);
4941 pserialize_read_exit(s);
4942
4943 /* if LARVAL entry doesn't become MATURE, delete it. */
4944 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
4945 restart_sav_LARVAL:
4946 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL) {
4947 if (now - sav->created > key_larval_lifetime) {
4948 key_sa_chgstate(sav, SADB_SASTATE_DEAD);
4949 goto restart_sav_LARVAL;
4950 }
4951 }
4952 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
4953
4954 /*
4955 * check MATURE entry to start to send expire message
4956 * whether or not.
4957 */
4958 restart_sav_MATURE:
4959 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
4960 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, SADB_SASTATE_MATURE) {
4961 /* we don't need to check. */
4962 if (sav->lft_s == NULL)
4963 continue;
4964
4965 /* sanity check */
4966 KASSERT(sav->lft_c != NULL);
4967
4968 /* check SOFT lifetime */
4969 if (sav->lft_s->sadb_lifetime_addtime != 0 &&
4970 now - sav->created > sav->lft_s->sadb_lifetime_addtime) {
4971 /*
4972 * check SA to be used whether or not.
4973 * when SA hasn't been used, delete it.
4974 */
4975 if (sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_usetime == 0) {
4976 key_sa_chgstate(sav, SADB_SASTATE_DEAD);
4977 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
4978 } else {
4979 key_sa_chgstate(sav, SADB_SASTATE_DYING);
4980 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
4981 /*
4982 * XXX If we keep to send expire
4983 * message in the status of
4984 * DYING. Do remove below code.
4985 */
4986 key_expire(sav);
4987 }
4988 goto restart_sav_MATURE;
4989 }
4990 /* check SOFT lifetime by bytes */
4991 /*
4992 * XXX I don't know the way to delete this SA
4993 * when new SA is installed. Caution when it's
4994 * installed too big lifetime by time.
4995 */
4996 else {
4997 uint64_t lft_c_bytes = 0;
4998 lifetime_counters_t sum = {0};
4999
5000 percpu_foreach(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu,
5001 key_sum_lifetime_counters, sum);
5002 lft_c_bytes = sum[LIFETIME_COUNTER_BYTES];
5003
5004 if (sav->lft_s->sadb_lifetime_bytes == 0 ||
5005 sav->lft_s->sadb_lifetime_bytes >= lft_c_bytes)
5006 continue;
5007
5008 key_sa_chgstate(sav, SADB_SASTATE_DYING);
5009 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5010 /*
5011 * XXX If we keep to send expire
5012 * message in the status of
5013 * DYING. Do remove below code.
5014 */
5015 key_expire(sav);
5016 goto restart_sav_MATURE;
5017 }
5018 }
5019 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5020
5021 /* check DYING entry to change status to DEAD. */
5022 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
5023 restart_sav_DYING:
5024 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, SADB_SASTATE_DYING) {
5025 /* we don't need to check. */
5026 if (sav->lft_h == NULL)
5027 continue;
5028
5029 /* sanity check */
5030 KASSERT(sav->lft_c != NULL);
5031
5032 if (sav->lft_h->sadb_lifetime_addtime != 0 &&
5033 now - sav->created > sav->lft_h->sadb_lifetime_addtime) {
5034 key_sa_chgstate(sav, SADB_SASTATE_DEAD);
5035 goto restart_sav_DYING;
5036 }
5037#if 0 /* XXX Should we keep to send expire message until HARD lifetime ? */
5038 else if (sav->lft_s != NULL
5039 && sav->lft_s->sadb_lifetime_addtime != 0
5040 && now - sav->created > sav->lft_s->sadb_lifetime_addtime) {
5041 /*
5042 * XXX: should be checked to be
5043 * installed the valid SA.
5044 */
5045
5046 /*
5047 * If there is no SA then sending
5048 * expire message.
5049 */
5050 key_expire(sav);
5051 }
5052#endif
5053 /* check HARD lifetime by bytes */
5054 else {
5055 uint64_t lft_c_bytes = 0;
5056 lifetime_counters_t sum = {0};
5057
5058 percpu_foreach(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu,
5059 key_sum_lifetime_counters, sum);
5060 lft_c_bytes = sum[LIFETIME_COUNTER_BYTES];
5061
5062 if (sav->lft_h->sadb_lifetime_bytes == 0 ||
5063 sav->lft_h->sadb_lifetime_bytes >= lft_c_bytes)
5064 continue;
5065
5066 key_sa_chgstate(sav, SADB_SASTATE_DEAD);
5067 goto restart_sav_DYING;
5068 }
5069 }
5070 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5071
5072 /* delete entry in DEAD */
5073 restart_sav_DEAD:
5074 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
5075 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, SADB_SASTATE_DEAD) {
5076 key_unlink_sav(sav);
5077 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5078 key_destroy_sav(sav);
5079 goto restart_sav_DEAD;
5080 }
5081 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5082
5083 s = pserialize_read_enter();
5084 key_sah_unref(sah);
5085 }
5086 pserialize_read_exit(s);
5087}
5088
5089static void
5090key_timehandler_acq(time_t now)
5091{
5092#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
5093 struct secacq *acq, *nextacq;
5094
5095 restart:
5096 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
5097 LIST_FOREACH_SAFE(acq, &key_misc.acqlist, chain, nextacq) {
5098 if (now - acq->created > key_blockacq_lifetime) {
5099 LIST_REMOVE(acq, chain);
5100 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
5101 kmem_free(acq, sizeof(*acq));
5102 goto restart;
5103 }
5104 }
5105 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
5106#endif
5107}
5108
5109static void
5110key_timehandler_spacq(time_t now)
5111{
5112#ifdef notyet
5113 struct secspacq *acq, *nextacq;
5114
5115 LIST_FOREACH_SAFE(acq, &key_misc.spacqlist, chain, nextacq) {
5116 if (now - acq->created > key_blockacq_lifetime) {
5117 KASSERT(__LIST_CHAINED(acq));
5118 LIST_REMOVE(acq, chain);
5119 kmem_free(acq, sizeof(*acq));
5120 }
5121 }
5122#endif
5123}
5124
5125static unsigned int key_timehandler_work_enqueued = 0;
5126
5127/*
5128 * time handler.
5129 * scanning SPD and SAD to check status for each entries,
5130 * and do to remove or to expire.
5131 */
5132static void
5133key_timehandler_work(struct work *wk, void *arg)
5134{
5135 time_t now = time_uptime;
5136
5137 /* We can allow enqueuing another work at this point */
5138 atomic_swap_uint(&key_timehandler_work_enqueued, 0);
5139
5140 key_timehandler_spd(now);
5141 key_timehandler_sad(now);
5142 key_timehandler_acq(now);
5143 key_timehandler_spacq(now);
5144
5145 key_acquire_sendup_pending_mbuf();
5146
5147 /* do exchange to tick time !! */
5148 callout_reset(&key_timehandler_ch, hz, key_timehandler, NULL);
5149
5150 return;
5151}
5152
5153static void
5154key_timehandler(void *arg)
5155{
5156
5157 /* Avoid enqueuing another work when one is already enqueued */
5158 if (atomic_swap_uint(&key_timehandler_work_enqueued, 1) == 1)
5159 return;
5160
5161 workqueue_enqueue(key_timehandler_wq, &key_timehandler_wk, NULL);
5162}
5163
5164u_long
5165key_random(void)
5166{
5167 u_long value;
5168
5169 key_randomfill(&value, sizeof(value));
5170 return value;
5171}
5172
5173void
5174key_randomfill(void *p, size_t l)
5175{
5176
5177 cprng_fast(p, l);
5178}
5179
5180/*
5181 * map SADB_SATYPE_* to IPPROTO_*.
5182 * if satype == SADB_SATYPE then satype is mapped to ~0.
5183 * OUT:
5184 * 0: invalid satype.
5185 */
5186static u_int16_t
5187key_satype2proto(u_int8_t satype)
5188{
5189 switch (satype) {
5190 case SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC:
5191 return IPSEC_PROTO_ANY;
5192 case SADB_SATYPE_AH:
5193 return IPPROTO_AH;
5194 case SADB_SATYPE_ESP:
5195 return IPPROTO_ESP;
5196 case SADB_X_SATYPE_IPCOMP:
5197 return IPPROTO_IPCOMP;
5198 case SADB_X_SATYPE_TCPSIGNATURE:
5199 return IPPROTO_TCP;
5200 default:
5201 return 0;
5202 }
5203 /* NOTREACHED */
5204}
5205
5206/*
5207 * map IPPROTO_* to SADB_SATYPE_*
5208 * OUT:
5209 * 0: invalid protocol type.
5210 */
5211static u_int8_t
5212key_proto2satype(u_int16_t proto)
5213{
5214 switch (proto) {
5215 case IPPROTO_AH:
5216 return SADB_SATYPE_AH;
5217 case IPPROTO_ESP:
5218 return SADB_SATYPE_ESP;
5219 case IPPROTO_IPCOMP:
5220 return SADB_X_SATYPE_IPCOMP;
5221 case IPPROTO_TCP:
5222 return SADB_X_SATYPE_TCPSIGNATURE;
5223 default:
5224 return 0;
5225 }
5226 /* NOTREACHED */
5227}
5228
5229static int
5230key_setsecasidx(int proto, int mode, int reqid,
5231 const struct sockaddr *src, const struct sockaddr *dst,
5232 struct secasindex * saidx)
5233{
5234 const union sockaddr_union *src_u = (const union sockaddr_union *)src;
5235 const union sockaddr_union *dst_u = (const union sockaddr_union *)dst;
5236
5237 /* sa len safety check */
5238 if (key_checksalen(src_u) != 0)
5239 return -1;
5240 if (key_checksalen(dst_u) != 0)
5241 return -1;
5242
5243 memset(saidx, 0, sizeof(*saidx));
5244 saidx->proto = proto;
5245 saidx->mode = mode;
5246 saidx->reqid = reqid;
5247 memcpy(&saidx->src, src_u, src_u->sa.sa_len);
5248 memcpy(&saidx->dst, dst_u, dst_u->sa.sa_len);
5249
5250 key_porttosaddr(&((saidx)->src), 0);
5251 key_porttosaddr(&((saidx)->dst), 0);
5252 return 0;
5253}
5254
5255static void
5256key_init_spidx_bymsghdr(struct secpolicyindex *spidx,
5257 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
5258{
5259 const struct sadb_address *src0, *dst0;
5260 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
5261 const struct sadb_x_policy *xpl0;
5262
5263 src0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC];
5264 dst0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST];
5265 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
5266 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
5267 xpl0 = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_POLICY];
5268
5269 memset(spidx, 0, sizeof(*spidx));
5270 spidx->dir = xpl0->sadb_x_policy_dir;
5271 spidx->prefs = src0->sadb_address_prefixlen;
5272 spidx->prefd = dst0->sadb_address_prefixlen;
5273 spidx->ul_proto = src0->sadb_address_proto;
5274 /* XXX boundary check against sa_len */
5275 memcpy(&spidx->src, src, src->sa_len);
5276 memcpy(&spidx->dst, dst, dst->sa_len);
5277}
5278
5279/* %%% PF_KEY */
5280/*
5281 * SADB_GETSPI processing is to receive
5282 * <base, (SA2), src address, dst address, (SPI range)>
5283 * from the IKMPd, to assign a unique spi value, to hang on the INBOUND
5284 * tree with the status of LARVAL, and send
5285 * <base, SA(*), address(SD)>
5286 * to the IKMPd.
5287 *
5288 * IN: mhp: pointer to the pointer to each header.
5289 * OUT: NULL if fail.
5290 * other if success, return pointer to the message to send.
5291 */
5292static int
5293key_api_getspi(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
5294 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
5295{
5296 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
5297 struct secasindex saidx;
5298 struct secashead *sah;
5299 struct secasvar *newsav;
5300 u_int8_t proto;
5301 u_int32_t spi;
5302 u_int8_t mode;
5303 u_int16_t reqid;
5304 int error;
5305
5306 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] == NULL ||
5307 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] == NULL) {
5308 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
5309 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5310 }
5311 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
5312 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] < sizeof(struct sadb_address)) {
5313 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
5314 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5315 }
5316 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_SA2] != NULL) {
5317 const struct sadb_x_sa2 *sa2 = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_SA2];
5318 mode = sa2->sadb_x_sa2_mode;
5319 reqid = sa2->sadb_x_sa2_reqid;
5320 } else {
5321 mode = IPSEC_MODE_ANY;
5322 reqid = 0;
5323 }
5324
5325 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
5326 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
5327
5328 /* map satype to proto */
5329 proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype);
5330 if (proto == 0) {
5331 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
5332 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5333 }
5334
5335
5336 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, mode, reqid, src, dst, &saidx);
5337 if (error != 0)
5338 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5339
5340 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
5341 if (error != 0)
5342 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5343
5344 /* SPI allocation */
5345 spi = key_do_getnewspi(mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SPIRANGE], &saidx);
5346 if (spi == 0)
5347 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5348
5349 /* get a SA index */
5350 sah = key_getsah_ref(&saidx, CMP_REQID);
5351 if (sah == NULL) {
5352 /* create a new SA index */
5353 sah = key_newsah(&saidx);
5354 if (sah == NULL) {
5355 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
5356 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOBUFS);
5357 }
5358 }
5359
5360 /* get a new SA */
5361 /* XXX rewrite */
5362 newsav = KEY_NEWSAV(m, mhp, &error);
5363 if (newsav == NULL) {
5364 key_sah_unref(sah);
5365 /* XXX don't free new SA index allocated in above. */
5366 return key_senderror(so, m, error);
5367 }
5368
5369 /* set spi */
5370 newsav->spi = htonl(spi);
5371
5372 /* Add to sah#savlist */
5373 key_init_sav(newsav);
5374 newsav->sah = sah;
5375 newsav->state = SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL;
5376 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
5377 SAVLIST_WRITER_INSERT_TAIL(sah, SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL, newsav);
5378 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5379 key_validate_savlist(sah, SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL);
5380
5381 key_sah_unref(sah);
5382
5383#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
5384 /* delete the entry in key_misc.acqlist */
5385 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq != 0) {
5386 struct secacq *acq;
5387 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
5388 acq = key_getacqbyseq(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq);
5389 if (acq != NULL) {
5390 /* reset counter in order to deletion by timehandler. */
5391 acq->created = time_uptime;
5392 acq->count = 0;
5393 }
5394 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
5395 }
5396#endif
5397
5398 {
5399 struct mbuf *n, *nn;
5400 struct sadb_sa *m_sa;
5401 int off, len;
5402
5403 CTASSERT(PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) +
5404 PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_sa)) <= MCLBYTES);
5405
5406 /* create new sadb_msg to reply. */
5407 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) +
5408 PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_sa));
5409
5410 n = key_alloc_mbuf_simple(len, M_WAITOK);
5411 n->m_len = len;
5412 n->m_next = NULL;
5413 off = 0;
5414
5415 m_copydata(m, 0, sizeof(struct sadb_msg), mtod(n, char *) + off);
5416 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
5417
5418 m_sa = (struct sadb_sa *)(mtod(n, char *) + off);
5419 m_sa->sadb_sa_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(struct sadb_sa));
5420 m_sa->sadb_sa_exttype = SADB_EXT_SA;
5421 m_sa->sadb_sa_spi = htonl(spi);
5422 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_sa));
5423
5424 KASSERTMSG(off == len, "length inconsistency");
5425
5426 n->m_next = key_gather_mbuf(m, mhp, 0, 2, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC,
5427 SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
5428
5429 KASSERT(n->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
5430
5431 n->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
5432 for (nn = n; nn; nn = nn->m_next)
5433 n->m_pkthdr.len += nn->m_len;
5434
5435 key_fill_replymsg(n, newsav->seq);
5436 m_freem(m);
5437 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_ONE);
5438 }
5439}
5440
5441/*
5442 * allocating new SPI
5443 * called by key_api_getspi().
5444 * OUT:
5445 * 0: failure.
5446 * others: success.
5447 */
5448static u_int32_t
5449key_do_getnewspi(const struct sadb_spirange *spirange,
5450 const struct secasindex *saidx)
5451{
5452 u_int32_t newspi;
5453 u_int32_t spmin, spmax;
5454 int count = key_spi_trycnt;
5455
5456 /* set spi range to allocate */
5457 if (spirange != NULL) {
5458 spmin = spirange->sadb_spirange_min;
5459 spmax = spirange->sadb_spirange_max;
5460 } else {
5461 spmin = key_spi_minval;
5462 spmax = key_spi_maxval;
5463 }
5464 /* IPCOMP needs 2-byte SPI */
5465 if (saidx->proto == IPPROTO_IPCOMP) {
5466 u_int32_t t;
5467 if (spmin >= 0x10000)
5468 spmin = 0xffff;
5469 if (spmax >= 0x10000)
5470 spmax = 0xffff;
5471 if (spmin > spmax) {
5472 t = spmin; spmin = spmax; spmax = t;
5473 }
5474 }
5475
5476 if (spmin == spmax) {
5477 if (key_checkspidup(saidx, htonl(spmin))) {
5478 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "SPI %u exists already.\n", spmin);
5479 return 0;
5480 }
5481
5482 count--; /* taking one cost. */
5483 newspi = spmin;
5484
5485 } else {
5486
5487 /* init SPI */
5488 newspi = 0;
5489
5490 /* when requesting to allocate spi ranged */
5491 while (count--) {
5492 /* generate pseudo-random SPI value ranged. */
5493 newspi = spmin + (key_random() % (spmax - spmin + 1));
5494
5495 if (!key_checkspidup(saidx, htonl(newspi)))
5496 break;
5497 }
5498
5499 if (count == 0 || newspi == 0) {
5500 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "to allocate spi is failed.\n");
5501 return 0;
5502 }
5503 }
5504
5505 /* statistics */
5506 keystat.getspi_count =
5507 (keystat.getspi_count + key_spi_trycnt - count) / 2;
5508
5509 return newspi;
5510}
5511
5512static int
5513key_handle_natt_info(struct secasvar *sav,
5514 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
5515{
5516 const char *msg = "?" ;
5517 struct sadb_x_nat_t_type *type;
5518 struct sadb_x_nat_t_port *sport, *dport;
5519 struct sadb_address *iaddr, *raddr;
5520 struct sadb_x_nat_t_frag *frag;
5521
5522 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE] == NULL ||
5523 mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT] == NULL ||
5524 mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT] == NULL)
5525 return 0;
5526
5527 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE] < sizeof(*type)) {
5528 msg = "TYPE";
5529 goto bad;
5530 }
5531
5532 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT] < sizeof(*sport)) {
5533 msg = "SPORT";
5534 goto bad;
5535 }
5536
5537 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT] < sizeof(*dport)) {
5538 msg = "DPORT";
5539 goto bad;
5540 }
5541
5542 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI] != NULL) {
5543 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "NAT-T OAi present\n");
5544 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI] < sizeof(*iaddr)) {
5545 msg = "OAI";
5546 goto bad;
5547 }
5548 }
5549
5550 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR] != NULL) {
5551 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "NAT-T OAr present\n");
5552 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR] < sizeof(*raddr)) {
5553 msg = "OAR";
5554 goto bad;
5555 }
5556 }
5557
5558 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG] != NULL) {
5559 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG] < sizeof(*frag)) {
5560 msg = "FRAG";
5561 goto bad;
5562 }
5563 }
5564
5565 type = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE];
5566 sport = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT];
5567 dport = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT];
5568 iaddr = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI];
5569 raddr = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR];
5570 frag = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG];
5571
5572 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "type %d, sport = %d, dport = %d\n",
5573 type->sadb_x_nat_t_type_type,
5574 ntohs(sport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port),
5575 ntohs(dport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port));
5576
5577 sav->natt_type = type->sadb_x_nat_t_type_type;
5578 key_porttosaddr(&sav->sah->saidx.src, sport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port);
5579 key_porttosaddr(&sav->sah->saidx.dst, dport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port);
5580 if (frag)
5581 sav->esp_frag = frag->sadb_x_nat_t_frag_fraglen;
5582 else
5583 sav->esp_frag = IP_MAXPACKET;
5584
5585 return 0;
5586bad:
5587 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message %s\n", msg);
5588 __USE(msg);
5589 return -1;
5590}
5591
5592/* Just update the IPSEC_NAT_T ports if present */
5593static int
5594key_set_natt_ports(union sockaddr_union *src, union sockaddr_union *dst,
5595 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
5596{
5597 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI] != NULL)
5598 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "NAT-T OAi present\n");
5599 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR] != NULL)
5600 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "NAT-T OAr present\n");
5601
5602 if ((mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE] != NULL) &&
5603 (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT] != NULL) &&
5604 (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT] != NULL)) {
5605 struct sadb_x_nat_t_type *type;
5606 struct sadb_x_nat_t_port *sport;
5607 struct sadb_x_nat_t_port *dport;
5608
5609 if ((mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE] < sizeof(*type)) ||
5610 (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT] < sizeof(*sport)) ||
5611 (mhp->extlen[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT] < sizeof(*dport))) {
5612 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message\n");
5613 return -1;
5614 }
5615
5616 type = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE];
5617 sport = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT];
5618 dport = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT];
5619
5620 key_porttosaddr(src, sport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port);
5621 key_porttosaddr(dst, dport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port);
5622
5623 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "type %d, sport = %d, dport = %d\n",
5624 type->sadb_x_nat_t_type_type,
5625 ntohs(sport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port),
5626 ntohs(dport->sadb_x_nat_t_port_port));
5627 }
5628
5629 return 0;
5630}
5631
5632
5633/*
5634 * SADB_UPDATE processing
5635 * receive
5636 * <base, SA, (SA2), (lifetime(HSC),) address(SD), (address(P),)
5637 * key(AE), (identity(SD),) (sensitivity)>
5638 * from the ikmpd, and update a secasvar entry whose status is SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL.
5639 * and send
5640 * <base, SA, (SA2), (lifetime(HSC),) address(SD), (address(P),)
5641 * (identity(SD),) (sensitivity)>
5642 * to the ikmpd.
5643 *
5644 * m will always be freed.
5645 */
5646static int
5647key_api_update(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m, const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
5648{
5649 struct sadb_sa *sa0;
5650 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
5651 struct secasindex saidx;
5652 struct secashead *sah;
5653 struct secasvar *sav, *newsav, *oldsav;
5654 u_int16_t proto;
5655 u_int8_t mode;
5656 u_int16_t reqid;
5657 int error;
5658
5659 /* map satype to proto */
5660 proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype);
5661 if (proto == 0) {
5662 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
5663 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5664 }
5665
5666 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA] == NULL ||
5667 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] == NULL ||
5668 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] == NULL ||
5669 (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype == SADB_SATYPE_ESP &&
5670 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT] == NULL) ||
5671 (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype == SADB_SATYPE_AH &&
5672 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH] == NULL) ||
5673 (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD] != NULL &&
5674 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT] == NULL) ||
5675 (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD] == NULL &&
5676 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT] != NULL)) {
5677 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
5678 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5679 }
5680 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_SA] < sizeof(struct sadb_sa) ||
5681 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
5682 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] < sizeof(struct sadb_address)) {
5683 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
5684 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5685 }
5686 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_SA2] != NULL) {
5687 const struct sadb_x_sa2 *sa2 = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_SA2];
5688 mode = sa2->sadb_x_sa2_mode;
5689 reqid = sa2->sadb_x_sa2_reqid;
5690 } else {
5691 mode = IPSEC_MODE_ANY;
5692 reqid = 0;
5693 }
5694 /* XXX boundary checking for other extensions */
5695
5696 sa0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA];
5697 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
5698 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
5699
5700 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, mode, reqid, src, dst, &saidx);
5701 if (error != 0)
5702 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5703
5704 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
5705 if (error != 0)
5706 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5707
5708 /* get a SA header */
5709 sah = key_getsah_ref(&saidx, CMP_REQID);
5710 if (sah == NULL) {
5711 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "no SA index found.\n");
5712 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOENT);
5713 }
5714
5715 /* set spidx if there */
5716 /* XXX rewrite */
5717 error = key_setident(sah, m, mhp);
5718 if (error)
5719 goto error_sah;
5720
5721 /* find a SA with sequence number. */
5722#ifdef IPSEC_DOSEQCHECK
5723 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq != 0) {
5724 sav = key_getsavbyseq(sah, mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq);
5725 if (sav == NULL) {
5726 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
5727 "no larval SA with sequence %u exists.\n",
5728 mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq);
5729 error = ENOENT;
5730 goto error_sah;
5731 }
5732 }
5733#else
5734 sav = key_getsavbyspi(sah, sa0->sadb_sa_spi);
5735 if (sav == NULL) {
5736 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "no such a SA found (spi:%u)\n",
5737 (u_int32_t)ntohl(sa0->sadb_sa_spi));
5738 error = EINVAL;
5739 goto error_sah;
5740 }
5741#endif
5742
5743 /* validity check */
5744 if (sav->sah->saidx.proto != proto) {
5745 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "protocol mismatched (DB=%u param=%u)\n",
5746 sav->sah->saidx.proto, proto);
5747 error = EINVAL;
5748 goto error;
5749 }
5750#ifdef IPSEC_DOSEQCHECK
5751 if (sav->spi != sa0->sadb_sa_spi) {
5752 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "SPI mismatched (DB:%u param:%u)\n",
5753 (u_int32_t)ntohl(sav->spi),
5754 (u_int32_t)ntohl(sa0->sadb_sa_spi));
5755 error = EINVAL;
5756 goto error;
5757 }
5758#endif
5759 if (sav->pid != mhp->msg->sadb_msg_pid) {
5760 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "pid mismatched (DB:%u param:%u)\n",
5761 sav->pid, mhp->msg->sadb_msg_pid);
5762 error = EINVAL;
5763 goto error;
5764 }
5765
5766 /*
5767 * Allocate a new SA instead of modifying the existing SA directly
5768 * to avoid race conditions.
5769 */
5770 newsav = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(struct secasvar), KM_SLEEP);
5771
5772 /* copy sav values */
5773 newsav->spi = sav->spi;
5774 newsav->seq = sav->seq;
5775 newsav->created = sav->created;
5776 newsav->pid = sav->pid;
5777 newsav->sah = sav->sah;
5778
5779 error = key_setsaval(newsav, m, mhp);
5780 if (error) {
5781 kmem_free(newsav, sizeof(*newsav));
5782 goto error;
5783 }
5784
5785 error = key_handle_natt_info(newsav, mhp);
5786 if (error != 0) {
5787 key_delsav(newsav);
5788 goto error;
5789 }
5790
5791 error = key_init_xform(newsav);
5792 if (error != 0) {
5793 key_delsav(newsav);
5794 goto error;
5795 }
5796
5797 /* Add to sah#savlist */
5798 key_init_sav(newsav);
5799 newsav->state = SADB_SASTATE_MATURE;
5800 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
5801 SAVLIST_WRITER_INSERT_TAIL(sah, SADB_SASTATE_MATURE, newsav);
5802 SAVLUT_WRITER_INSERT_HEAD(newsav);
5803 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
5804 key_validate_savlist(sah, SADB_SASTATE_MATURE);
5805
5806 /*
5807 * We need to lookup and remove the sav atomically, so get it again
5808 * here by a special API while we have a reference to it.
5809 */
5810 oldsav = key_lookup_and_remove_sav(sah, sa0->sadb_sa_spi);
5811 /* We can release the reference because of oldsav */
5812 KEY_SA_UNREF(&sav);
5813 if (oldsav == NULL) {
5814 /* Someone has already removed the sav. Nothing to do. */
5815 } else {
5816 key_wait_sav(oldsav);
5817 key_destroy_sav(oldsav);
5818 oldsav = NULL;
5819 }
5820 sav = NULL;
5821
5822 key_sah_unref(sah);
5823 sah = NULL;
5824
5825 {
5826 struct mbuf *n;
5827
5828 /* set msg buf from mhp */
5829 n = key_getmsgbuf_x1(m, mhp);
5830 if (n == NULL) {
5831 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
5832 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOBUFS);
5833 }
5834
5835 m_freem(m);
5836 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
5837 }
5838error:
5839 KEY_SA_UNREF(&sav);
5840error_sah:
5841 key_sah_unref(sah);
5842 return key_senderror(so, m, error);
5843}
5844
5845/*
5846 * search SAD with sequence for a SA which state is SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL.
5847 * only called by key_api_update().
5848 * OUT:
5849 * NULL : not found
5850 * others : found, pointer to a SA.
5851 */
5852#ifdef IPSEC_DOSEQCHECK
5853static struct secasvar *
5854key_getsavbyseq(struct secashead *sah, u_int32_t seq)
5855{
5856 struct secasvar *sav;
5857 u_int state;
5858 int s;
5859
5860 state = SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL;
5861
5862 /* search SAD with sequence number ? */
5863 s = pserialize_read_enter();
5864 SAVLIST_READER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
5865 KEY_CHKSASTATE(state, sav->state);
5866
5867 if (sav->seq == seq) {
5868 SA_ADDREF(sav);
5869 KEYDEBUG_PRINTF(KEYDEBUG_IPSEC_STAMP,
5870 "DP cause refcnt++:%d SA:%p\n",
5871 key_sa_refcnt(sav), sav);
5872 break;
5873 }
5874 }
5875 pserialize_read_exit(s);
5876
5877 return sav;
5878}
5879#endif
5880
5881/*
5882 * SADB_ADD processing
5883 * add an entry to SA database, when received
5884 * <base, SA, (SA2), (lifetime(HSC),) address(SD), (address(P),)
5885 * key(AE), (identity(SD),) (sensitivity)>
5886 * from the ikmpd,
5887 * and send
5888 * <base, SA, (SA2), (lifetime(HSC),) address(SD), (address(P),)
5889 * (identity(SD),) (sensitivity)>
5890 * to the ikmpd.
5891 *
5892 * IGNORE identity and sensitivity messages.
5893 *
5894 * m will always be freed.
5895 */
5896static int
5897key_api_add(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
5898 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
5899{
5900 struct sadb_sa *sa0;
5901 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
5902 struct secasindex saidx;
5903 struct secashead *sah;
5904 struct secasvar *newsav;
5905 u_int16_t proto;
5906 u_int8_t mode;
5907 u_int16_t reqid;
5908 int error;
5909
5910 /* map satype to proto */
5911 proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype);
5912 if (proto == 0) {
5913 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
5914 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5915 }
5916
5917 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA] == NULL ||
5918 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] == NULL ||
5919 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] == NULL ||
5920 (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype == SADB_SATYPE_ESP &&
5921 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT] == NULL) ||
5922 (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype == SADB_SATYPE_AH &&
5923 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH] == NULL) ||
5924 (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD] != NULL &&
5925 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT] == NULL) ||
5926 (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD] == NULL &&
5927 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT] != NULL)) {
5928 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
5929 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5930 }
5931 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_SA] < sizeof(struct sadb_sa) ||
5932 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
5933 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] < sizeof(struct sadb_address)) {
5934 /* XXX need more */
5935 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
5936 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5937 }
5938 if (mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_SA2] != NULL) {
5939 const struct sadb_x_sa2 *sa2 = mhp->ext[SADB_X_EXT_SA2];
5940 mode = sa2->sadb_x_sa2_mode;
5941 reqid = sa2->sadb_x_sa2_reqid;
5942 } else {
5943 mode = IPSEC_MODE_ANY;
5944 reqid = 0;
5945 }
5946
5947 sa0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA];
5948 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
5949 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
5950
5951 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, mode, reqid, src, dst, &saidx);
5952 if (error != 0)
5953 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5954
5955 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
5956 if (error != 0)
5957 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
5958
5959 /* get a SA header */
5960 sah = key_getsah_ref(&saidx, CMP_REQID);
5961 if (sah == NULL) {
5962 /* create a new SA header */
5963 sah = key_newsah(&saidx);
5964 if (sah == NULL) {
5965 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
5966 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOBUFS);
5967 }
5968 }
5969
5970 /* set spidx if there */
5971 /* XXX rewrite */
5972 error = key_setident(sah, m, mhp);
5973 if (error)
5974 goto error;
5975
5976 {
5977 struct secasvar *sav;
5978
5979 /* We can create new SA only if SPI is differenct. */
5980 sav = key_getsavbyspi(sah, sa0->sadb_sa_spi);
5981 if (sav != NULL) {
5982 KEY_SA_UNREF(&sav);
5983 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "SA already exists.\n");
5984 error = EEXIST;
5985 goto error;
5986 }
5987 }
5988
5989 /* create new SA entry. */
5990 newsav = KEY_NEWSAV(m, mhp, &error);
5991 if (newsav == NULL)
5992 goto error;
5993 newsav->sah = sah;
5994
5995 error = key_handle_natt_info(newsav, mhp);
5996 if (error != 0) {
5997 key_delsav(newsav);
5998 error = EINVAL;
5999 goto error;
6000 }
6001
6002 error = key_init_xform(newsav);
6003 if (error != 0) {
6004 key_delsav(newsav);
6005 goto error;
6006 }
6007
6008 /* Add to sah#savlist */
6009 key_init_sav(newsav);
6010 newsav->state = SADB_SASTATE_MATURE;
6011 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
6012 SAVLIST_WRITER_INSERT_TAIL(sah, SADB_SASTATE_MATURE, newsav);
6013 SAVLUT_WRITER_INSERT_HEAD(newsav);
6014 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
6015 key_validate_savlist(sah, SADB_SASTATE_MATURE);
6016
6017 key_sah_unref(sah);
6018 sah = NULL;
6019
6020 /*
6021 * don't call key_freesav() here, as we would like to keep the SA
6022 * in the database on success.
6023 */
6024
6025 {
6026 struct mbuf *n;
6027
6028 /* set msg buf from mhp */
6029 n = key_getmsgbuf_x1(m, mhp);
6030 if (n == NULL) {
6031 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
6032 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOBUFS);
6033 }
6034
6035 m_freem(m);
