6036 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
6037 }
6038error:
6039 key_sah_unref(sah);
6040 return key_senderror(so, m, error);
6041}
6042
6043/* m is retained */
6044static int
6045key_setident(struct secashead *sah, struct mbuf *m,
6046 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
6047{
6048 const struct sadb_ident *idsrc, *iddst;
6049 int idsrclen, iddstlen;
6050
6051 KASSERT(!cpu_softintr_p());
6052 KASSERT(sah != NULL);
6053 KASSERT(m != NULL);
6054 KASSERT(mhp != NULL);
6055 KASSERT(mhp->msg != NULL);
6056
6057 /*
6058 * Can be called with an existing sah from key_api_update().
6059 */
6060 if (sah->idents != NULL) {
6061 kmem_free(sah->idents, sah->idents_len);
6062 sah->idents = NULL;
6063 sah->idents_len = 0;
6064 }
6065 if (sah->identd != NULL) {
6066 kmem_free(sah->identd, sah->identd_len);
6067 sah->identd = NULL;
6068 sah->identd_len = 0;
6069 }
6070
6071 /* don't make buffer if not there */
6072 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC] == NULL &&
6073 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST] == NULL) {
6074 sah->idents = NULL;
6075 sah->identd = NULL;
6076 return 0;
6077 }
6078
6079 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC] == NULL ||
6080 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST] == NULL) {
6081 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid identity.\n");
6082 return EINVAL;
6083 }
6084
6085 idsrc = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC];
6086 iddst = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST];
6087 idsrclen = mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC];
6088 iddstlen = mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST];
6089
6090 /* validity check */
6091 if (idsrc->sadb_ident_type != iddst->sadb_ident_type) {
6092 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "ident type mismatched src %u, dst %u.\n",
6093 idsrc->sadb_ident_type, iddst->sadb_ident_type);
6094 return EINVAL;
6095 }
6096
6097 switch (idsrc->sadb_ident_type) {
6098 case SADB_IDENTTYPE_PREFIX:
6099 case SADB_IDENTTYPE_FQDN:
6100 case SADB_IDENTTYPE_USERFQDN:
6101 default:
6102 /* XXX do nothing */
6103 sah->idents = NULL;
6104 sah->identd = NULL;
6105 return 0;
6106 }
6107
6108 /* make structure */
6109 sah->idents = kmem_alloc(idsrclen, KM_SLEEP);
6110 sah->idents_len = idsrclen;
6111 sah->identd = kmem_alloc(iddstlen, KM_SLEEP);
6112 sah->identd_len = iddstlen;
6113 memcpy(sah->idents, idsrc, idsrclen);
6114 memcpy(sah->identd, iddst, iddstlen);
6115
6116 return 0;
6117}
6118
6119/*
6120 * m will not be freed on return. It never return NULL.
6121 * it is caller's responsibility to free the result.
6122 */
6123static struct mbuf *
6124key_getmsgbuf_x1(struct mbuf *m, const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
6125{
6126 struct mbuf *n;
6127
6128 KASSERT(m != NULL);
6129 KASSERT(mhp != NULL);
6130 KASSERT(mhp->msg != NULL);
6131
6132 /* create new sadb_msg to reply. */
6133 n = key_gather_mbuf(m, mhp, 1, 15, SADB_EXT_RESERVED,
6134 SADB_EXT_SA, SADB_X_EXT_SA2,
6135 SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST,
6136 SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD, SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT,
6137 SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC, SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST,
6138 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE, SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT,
6139 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT, SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI,
6140 SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR, SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG);
6141
6142 KASSERT(n->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
6143
6144 mtod(n, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_errno = 0;
6145 mtod(n, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_len =
6146 PFKEY_UNIT64(n->m_pkthdr.len);
6147
6148 return n;
6149}
6150
6151static int key_delete_all (struct socket *, struct mbuf *,
6152 const struct sadb_msghdr *, u_int16_t);
6153
6154/*
6155 * SADB_DELETE processing
6156 * receive
6157 * <base, SA(*), address(SD)>
6158 * from the ikmpd, and set SADB_SASTATE_DEAD,
6159 * and send,
6160 * <base, SA(*), address(SD)>
6161 * to the ikmpd.
6162 *
6163 * m will always be freed.
6164 */
6165static int
6166key_api_delete(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
6167 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
6168{
6169 struct sadb_sa *sa0;
6170 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
6171 struct secasindex saidx;
6172 struct secashead *sah;
6173 struct secasvar *sav = NULL;
6174 u_int16_t proto;
6175 int error;
6176
6177 /* map satype to proto */
6178 proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype);
6179 if (proto == 0) {
6180 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
6181 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6182 }
6183
6184 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] == NULL ||
6185 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] == NULL) {
6186 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
6187 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6188 }
6189
6190 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
6191 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] < sizeof(struct sadb_address)) {
6192 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
6193 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6194 }
6195
6196 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA] == NULL) {
6197 /*
6198 * Caller wants us to delete all non-LARVAL SAs
6199 * that match the src/dst. This is used during
6200 * IKE INITIAL-CONTACT.
6201 */
6202 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "doing delete all.\n");
6203 return key_delete_all(so, m, mhp, proto);
6204 } else if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_SA] < sizeof(struct sadb_sa)) {
6205 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
6206 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6207 }
6208
6209 sa0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA];
6210 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
6211 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
6212
6213 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, IPSEC_MODE_ANY, 0, src, dst, &saidx);
6214 if (error != 0)
6215 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6216
6217 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
6218 if (error != 0)
6219 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6220
6221 /* get a SA header */
6222 sah = key_getsah_ref(&saidx, CMP_HEAD);
6223 if (sah != NULL) {
6224 /* get a SA with SPI. */
6225 sav = key_lookup_and_remove_sav(sah, sa0->sadb_sa_spi);
6226 key_sah_unref(sah);
6227 }
6228
6229 if (sav == NULL) {
6230 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "no SA found.\n");
6231 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOENT);
6232 }
6233
6234 key_wait_sav(sav);
6235 key_destroy_sav(sav);
6236 sav = NULL;
6237
6238 {
6239 struct mbuf *n;
6240
6241 /* create new sadb_msg to reply. */
6242 n = key_gather_mbuf(m, mhp, 1, 4, SADB_EXT_RESERVED,
6243 SADB_EXT_SA, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
6244
6245 key_fill_replymsg(n, 0);
6246 m_freem(m);
6247 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
6248 }
6249}
6250
6251/*
6252 * delete all SAs for src/dst. Called from key_api_delete().
6253 */
6254static int
6255key_delete_all(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
6256 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp, u_int16_t proto)
6257{
6258 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
6259 struct secasindex saidx;
6260 struct secashead *sah;
6261 struct secasvar *sav;
6262 u_int state;
6263 int error;
6264
6265 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
6266 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
6267
6268 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, IPSEC_MODE_ANY, 0, src, dst, &saidx);
6269 if (error != 0)
6270 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6271
6272 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
6273 if (error != 0)
6274 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6275
6276 sah = key_getsah_ref(&saidx, CMP_HEAD);
6277 if (sah != NULL) {
6278 /* Delete all non-LARVAL SAs. */
6279 SASTATE_ALIVE_FOREACH(state) {
6280 if (state == SADB_SASTATE_LARVAL)
6281 continue;
6282 restart:
6283 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
6284 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
6285 sav->state = SADB_SASTATE_DEAD;
6286 key_unlink_sav(sav);
6287 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
6288 key_destroy_sav(sav);
6289 goto restart;
6290 }
6291 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
6292 }
6293 key_sah_unref(sah);
6294 }
6295 {
6296 struct mbuf *n;
6297
6298 /* create new sadb_msg to reply. */
6299 n = key_gather_mbuf(m, mhp, 1, 3, SADB_EXT_RESERVED,
6300 SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
6301
6302 key_fill_replymsg(n, 0);
6303 m_freem(m);
6304 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
6305 }
6306}
6307
6308/*
6309 * SADB_GET processing
6310 * receive
6311 * <base, SA(*), address(SD)>
6312 * from the ikmpd, and get a SP and a SA to respond,
6313 * and send,
6314 * <base, SA, (lifetime(HSC),) address(SD), (address(P),) key(AE),
6315 * (identity(SD),) (sensitivity)>
6316 * to the ikmpd.
6317 *
6318 * m will always be freed.
6319 */
6320static int
6321key_api_get(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
6322 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
6323{
6324 struct sadb_sa *sa0;
6325 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
6326 struct secasindex saidx;
6327 struct secasvar *sav = NULL;
6328 u_int16_t proto;
6329 int error;
6330
6331 /* map satype to proto */
6332 if ((proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype)) == 0) {
6333 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
6334 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6335 }
6336
6337 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA] == NULL ||
6338 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] == NULL ||
6339 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] == NULL) {
6340 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
6341 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6342 }
6343 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_SA] < sizeof(struct sadb_sa) ||
6344 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
6345 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] < sizeof(struct sadb_address)) {
6346 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
6347 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6348 }
6349
6350 sa0 = mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_SA];
6351 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
6352 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
6353
6354 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, IPSEC_MODE_ANY, 0, src, dst, &saidx);
6355 if (error != 0)
6356 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6357
6358 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
6359 if (error != 0)
6360 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6361
6362 /* get a SA header */
6363 {
6364 struct secashead *sah;
6365 int s = pserialize_read_enter();
6366
6367 sah = key_getsah(&saidx, CMP_HEAD);
6368 if (sah != NULL) {
6369 /* get a SA with SPI. */
6370 sav = key_getsavbyspi(sah, sa0->sadb_sa_spi);
6371 }
6372 pserialize_read_exit(s);
6373 }
6374 if (sav == NULL) {
6375 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "no SA found.\n");
6376 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOENT);
6377 }
6378
6379 {
6380 struct mbuf *n;
6381 u_int8_t satype;
6382
6383 /* map proto to satype */
6384 satype = key_proto2satype(sav->sah->saidx.proto);
6385 if (satype == 0) {
6386 KEY_SA_UNREF(&sav);
6387 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "there was invalid proto in SAD.\n");
6388 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
6389 }
6390
6391 /* create new sadb_msg to reply. */
6392 n = key_setdumpsa(sav, SADB_GET, satype, mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq,
6393 mhp->msg->sadb_msg_pid);
6394 KEY_SA_UNREF(&sav);
6395 m_freem(m);
6396 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_ONE);
6397 }
6398}
6399
6400/* XXX make it sysctl-configurable? */
6401static void
6402key_getcomb_setlifetime(struct sadb_comb *comb)
6403{
6404
6405 comb->sadb_comb_soft_allocations = 1;
6406 comb->sadb_comb_hard_allocations = 1;
6407 comb->sadb_comb_soft_bytes = 0;
6408 comb->sadb_comb_hard_bytes = 0;
6409 comb->sadb_comb_hard_addtime = 86400; /* 1 day */
6410 comb->sadb_comb_soft_addtime = comb->sadb_comb_hard_addtime * 80 / 100;
6411 comb->sadb_comb_hard_usetime = 28800; /* 8 hours */
6412 comb->sadb_comb_soft_usetime = comb->sadb_comb_hard_usetime * 80 / 100;
6413}
6414
6415/*
6416 * XXX reorder combinations by preference
6417 * XXX no idea if the user wants ESP authentication or not
6418 */
6419static struct mbuf *
6420key_getcomb_esp(int mflag)
6421{
6422 struct sadb_comb *comb;
6423 const struct enc_xform *algo;
6424 struct mbuf *result = NULL, *m, *n;
6425 int encmin;
6426 int i, off, o;
6427 int totlen;
6428 const int l = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_comb));
6429
6430 m = NULL;
6431 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_EALG_MAX; i++) {
6432 algo = esp_algorithm_lookup(i);
6433 if (algo == NULL)
6434 continue;
6435
6436 /* discard algorithms with key size smaller than system min */
6437 if (_BITS(algo->maxkey) < ipsec_esp_keymin)
6438 continue;
6439 if (_BITS(algo->minkey) < ipsec_esp_keymin)
6440 encmin = ipsec_esp_keymin;
6441 else
6442 encmin = _BITS(algo->minkey);
6443
6444 if (ipsec_esp_auth)
6445 m = key_getcomb_ah(mflag);
6446 else {
6447 KASSERTMSG(l <= MLEN,
6448 "l=%u > MLEN=%lu", l, (u_long) MLEN);
6449 MGET(m, mflag, MT_DATA);
6450 if (m) {
6451 m_align(m, l);
6452 m->m_len = l;
6453 m->m_next = NULL;
6454 memset(mtod(m, void *), 0, m->m_len);
6455 }
6456 }
6457 if (!m)
6458 goto fail;
6459
6460 totlen = 0;
6461 for (n = m; n; n = n->m_next)
6462 totlen += n->m_len;
6463 KASSERTMSG((totlen % l) == 0, "totlen=%u, l=%u", totlen, l);
6464
6465 for (off = 0; off < totlen; off += l) {
6466 n = m_pulldown(m, off, l, &o);
6467 if (!n) {
6468 /* m is already freed */
6469 goto fail;
6470 }
6471 comb = (struct sadb_comb *)(mtod(n, char *) + o);
6472 memset(comb, 0, sizeof(*comb));
6473 key_getcomb_setlifetime(comb);
6474 comb->sadb_comb_encrypt = i;
6475 comb->sadb_comb_encrypt_minbits = encmin;
6476 comb->sadb_comb_encrypt_maxbits = _BITS(algo->maxkey);
6477 }
6478
6479 if (!result)
6480 result = m;
6481 else
6482 m_cat(result, m);
6483 }
6484
6485 return result;
6486
6487 fail:
6488 if (result)
6489 m_freem(result);
6490 return NULL;
6491}
6492
6493static void
6494key_getsizes_ah(const struct auth_hash *ah, int alg,
6495 u_int16_t* ksmin, u_int16_t* ksmax)
6496{
6497 *ksmin = *ksmax = ah->keysize;
6498 if (ah->keysize == 0) {
6499 /*
6500 * Transform takes arbitrary key size but algorithm
6501 * key size is restricted. Enforce this here.
6502 */
6503 switch (alg) {
6504 case SADB_X_AALG_MD5: *ksmin = *ksmax = 16; break;
6505 case SADB_X_AALG_SHA: *ksmin = *ksmax = 20; break;
6506 case SADB_X_AALG_NULL: *ksmin = 0; *ksmax = 256; break;
6507 default:
6508 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "unknown AH algorithm %u\n", alg);
6509 break;
6510 }
6511 }
6512}
6513
6514/*
6515 * XXX reorder combinations by preference
6516 */
6517static struct mbuf *
6518key_getcomb_ah(int mflag)
6519{
6520 struct sadb_comb *comb;
6521 const struct auth_hash *algo;
6522 struct mbuf *m;
6523 u_int16_t minkeysize, maxkeysize;
6524 int i;
6525 const int l = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_comb));
6526
6527 m = NULL;
6528 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_AALG_MAX; i++) {
6529#if 1
6530 /* we prefer HMAC algorithms, not old algorithms */
6531 if (i != SADB_AALG_SHA1HMAC &&
6532 i != SADB_AALG_MD5HMAC &&
6533 i != SADB_X_AALG_SHA2_256 &&
6534 i != SADB_X_AALG_SHA2_384 &&
6535 i != SADB_X_AALG_SHA2_512)
6536 continue;
6537#endif
6538 algo = ah_algorithm_lookup(i);
6539 if (!algo)
6540 continue;
6541 key_getsizes_ah(algo, i, &minkeysize, &maxkeysize);
6542 /* discard algorithms with key size smaller than system min */
6543 if (_BITS(minkeysize) < ipsec_ah_keymin)
6544 continue;
6545
6546 if (!m) {
6547 KASSERTMSG(l <= MLEN,
6548 "l=%u > MLEN=%lu", l, (u_long) MLEN);
6549 MGET(m, mflag, MT_DATA);
6550 if (m) {
6551 m_align(m, l);
6552 m->m_len = l;
6553 m->m_next = NULL;
6554 }
6555 } else
6556 M_PREPEND(m, l, mflag);
6557 if (!m)
6558 return NULL;
6559
6560 if (m->m_len < sizeof(struct sadb_comb)) {
6561 m = m_pullup(m, sizeof(struct sadb_comb));
6562 if (m == NULL)
6563 return NULL;
6564 }
6565
6566 comb = mtod(m, struct sadb_comb *);
6567 memset(comb, 0, sizeof(*comb));
6568 key_getcomb_setlifetime(comb);
6569 comb->sadb_comb_auth = i;
6570 comb->sadb_comb_auth_minbits = _BITS(minkeysize);
6571 comb->sadb_comb_auth_maxbits = _BITS(maxkeysize);
6572 }
6573
6574 return m;
6575}
6576
6577/*
6578 * not really an official behavior. discussed in pf_key@inner.net in Sep2000.
6579 * XXX reorder combinations by preference
6580 */
6581static struct mbuf *
6582key_getcomb_ipcomp(int mflag)
6583{
6584 struct sadb_comb *comb;
6585 const struct comp_algo *algo;
6586 struct mbuf *m;
6587 int i;
6588 const int l = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_comb));
6589
6590 m = NULL;
6591 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_X_CALG_MAX; i++) {
6592 algo = ipcomp_algorithm_lookup(i);
6593 if (!algo)
6594 continue;
6595
6596 if (!m) {
6597 KASSERTMSG(l <= MLEN,
6598 "l=%u > MLEN=%lu", l, (u_long) MLEN);
6599 MGET(m, mflag, MT_DATA);
6600 if (m) {
6601 m_align(m, l);
6602 m->m_len = l;
6603 m->m_next = NULL;
6604 }
6605 } else
6606 M_PREPEND(m, l, mflag);
6607 if (!m)
6608 return NULL;
6609
6610 if (m->m_len < sizeof(struct sadb_comb)) {
6611 m = m_pullup(m, sizeof(struct sadb_comb));
6612 if (m == NULL)
6613 return NULL;
6614 }
6615
6616 comb = mtod(m, struct sadb_comb *);
6617 memset(comb, 0, sizeof(*comb));
6618 key_getcomb_setlifetime(comb);
6619 comb->sadb_comb_encrypt = i;
6620 /* what should we set into sadb_comb_*_{min,max}bits? */
6621 }
6622
6623 return m;
6624}
6625
6626/*
6627 * XXX no way to pass mode (transport/tunnel) to userland
6628 * XXX replay checking?
6629 * XXX sysctl interface to ipsec_{ah,esp}_keymin
6630 */
6631static struct mbuf *
6632key_getprop(const struct secasindex *saidx, int mflag)
6633{
6634 struct sadb_prop *prop;
6635 struct mbuf *m, *n;
6636 const int l = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_prop));
6637 int totlen;
6638
6639 switch (saidx->proto) {
6640 case IPPROTO_ESP:
6641 m = key_getcomb_esp(mflag);
6642 break;
6643 case IPPROTO_AH:
6644 m = key_getcomb_ah(mflag);
6645 break;
6646 case IPPROTO_IPCOMP:
6647 m = key_getcomb_ipcomp(mflag);
6648 break;
6649 default:
6650 return NULL;
6651 }
6652
6653 if (!m)
6654 return NULL;
6655 M_PREPEND(m, l, mflag);
6656 if (!m)
6657 return NULL;
6658
6659 totlen = 0;
6660 for (n = m; n; n = n->m_next)
6661 totlen += n->m_len;
6662
6663 prop = mtod(m, struct sadb_prop *);
6664 memset(prop, 0, sizeof(*prop));
6665 prop->sadb_prop_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(totlen);
6666 prop->sadb_prop_exttype = SADB_EXT_PROPOSAL;
6667 prop->sadb_prop_replay = 32; /* XXX */
6668
6669 return m;
6670}
6671
6672/*
6673 * SADB_ACQUIRE processing called by key_checkrequest() and key_api_acquire().
6674 * send
6675 * <base, SA, address(SD), (address(P)), x_policy,
6676 * (identity(SD),) (sensitivity,) proposal>
6677 * to KMD, and expect to receive
6678 * <base> with SADB_ACQUIRE if error occurred,
6679 * or
6680 * <base, src address, dst address, (SPI range)> with SADB_GETSPI
6681 * from KMD by PF_KEY.
6682 *
6683 * XXX x_policy is outside of RFC2367 (KAME extension).
6684 * XXX sensitivity is not supported.
6685 * XXX for ipcomp, RFC2367 does not define how to fill in proposal.
6686 * see comment for key_getcomb_ipcomp().
6687 *
6688 * OUT:
6689 * 0 : succeed
6690 * others: error number
6691 */
6692static int
6693key_acquire(const struct secasindex *saidx, const struct secpolicy *sp, int mflag)
6694{
6695 struct mbuf *result = NULL, *m;
6696#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
6697 struct secacq *newacq;
6698#endif
6699 u_int8_t satype;
6700 int error = -1;
6701 u_int32_t seq;
6702
6703 /* sanity check */
6704 KASSERT(saidx != NULL);
6705 satype = key_proto2satype(saidx->proto);
6706 KASSERTMSG(satype != 0, "null satype, protocol %u", saidx->proto);
6707
6708#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
6709 /*
6710 * We never do anything about acquirng SA. There is anather
6711 * solution that kernel blocks to send SADB_ACQUIRE message until
6712 * getting something message from IKEd. In later case, to be
6713 * managed with ACQUIRING list.
6714 */
6715 /* Get an entry to check whether sending message or not. */
6716 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
6717 newacq = key_getacq(saidx);
6718 if (newacq != NULL) {
6719 if (key_blockacq_count < newacq->count) {
6720 /* reset counter and do send message. */
6721 newacq->count = 0;
6722 } else {
6723 /* increment counter and do nothing. */
6724 newacq->count++;
6725 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
6726 return 0;
6727 }
6728 } else {
6729 /* make new entry for blocking to send SADB_ACQUIRE. */
6730 newacq = key_newacq(saidx);
6731 if (newacq == NULL) {
6732 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
6733 return ENOBUFS;
6734 }
6735
6736 /* add to key_misc.acqlist */
6737 LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&key_misc.acqlist, newacq, chain);
6738 }
6739
6740 seq = newacq->seq;
6741 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
6742#else
6743 seq = (acq_seq = (acq_seq == ~0 ? 1 : ++acq_seq));
6744#endif
6745 m = key_setsadbmsg(SADB_ACQUIRE, 0, satype, seq, 0, 0, mflag);
6746 if (!m) {
6747 error = ENOBUFS;
6748 goto fail;
6749 }
6750 result = m;
6751
6752 /* set sadb_address for saidx's. */
6753 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC, &saidx->src.sa, FULLMASK,
6754 IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, mflag);
6755 if (!m) {
6756 error = ENOBUFS;
6757 goto fail;
6758 }
6759 m_cat(result, m);
6760
6761 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST, &saidx->dst.sa, FULLMASK,
6762 IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, mflag);
6763 if (!m) {
6764 error = ENOBUFS;
6765 goto fail;
6766 }
6767 m_cat(result, m);
6768
6769 /* XXX proxy address (optional) */
6770
6771 /* set sadb_x_policy */
6772 if (sp) {
6773 m = key_setsadbxpolicy(sp->policy, sp->spidx.dir, sp->id,
6774 mflag);
6775 if (!m) {
6776 error = ENOBUFS;
6777 goto fail;
6778 }
6779 m_cat(result, m);
6780 }
6781
6782 /* XXX identity (optional) */
6783#if 0
6784 if (idexttype && fqdn) {
6785 /* create identity extension (FQDN) */
6786 struct sadb_ident *id;
6787 int fqdnlen;
6788
6789 fqdnlen = strlen(fqdn) + 1; /* +1 for terminating-NUL */
6790 id = (struct sadb_ident *)p;
6791 memset(id, 0, sizeof(*id) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(fqdnlen));
6792 id->sadb_ident_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(*id) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(fqdnlen));
6793 id->sadb_ident_exttype = idexttype;
6794 id->sadb_ident_type = SADB_IDENTTYPE_FQDN;
6795 memcpy(id + 1, fqdn, fqdnlen);
6796 p += sizeof(struct sadb_ident) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(fqdnlen);
6797 }
6798
6799 if (idexttype) {
6800 /* create identity extension (USERFQDN) */
6801 struct sadb_ident *id;
6802 int userfqdnlen;
6803
6804 if (userfqdn) {
6805 /* +1 for terminating-NUL */
6806 userfqdnlen = strlen(userfqdn) + 1;
6807 } else
6808 userfqdnlen = 0;
6809 id = (struct sadb_ident *)p;
6810 memset(id, 0, sizeof(*id) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(userfqdnlen));
6811 id->sadb_ident_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(*id) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(userfqdnlen));
6812 id->sadb_ident_exttype = idexttype;
6813 id->sadb_ident_type = SADB_IDENTTYPE_USERFQDN;
6814 /* XXX is it correct? */
6815 if (curlwp)
6816 id->sadb_ident_id = kauth_cred_getuid(curlwp->l_cred);
6817 if (userfqdn && userfqdnlen)
6818 memcpy(id + 1, userfqdn, userfqdnlen);
6819 p += sizeof(struct sadb_ident) + PFKEY_ALIGN8(userfqdnlen);
6820 }
6821#endif
6822
6823 /* XXX sensitivity (optional) */
6824
6825 /* create proposal/combination extension */
6826 m = key_getprop(saidx, mflag);
6827#if 0
6828 /*
6829 * spec conformant: always attach proposal/combination extension,
6830 * the problem is that we have no way to attach it for ipcomp,
6831 * due to the way sadb_comb is declared in RFC2367.
6832 */
6833 if (!m) {
6834 error = ENOBUFS;
6835 goto fail;
6836 }
6837 m_cat(result, m);
6838#else
6839 /*
6840 * outside of spec; make proposal/combination extension optional.
6841 */
6842 if (m)
6843 m_cat(result, m);
6844#endif
6845
6846 KASSERT(result->m_flags & M_PKTHDR);
6847 KASSERT(result->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
6848
6849 result->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
6850 for (m = result; m; m = m->m_next)
6851 result->m_pkthdr.len += m->m_len;
6852
6853 mtod(result, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_len =
6854 PFKEY_UNIT64(result->m_pkthdr.len);
6855
6856 /*
6857 * Called from key_api_acquire that must come from userland, so
6858 * we can call key_sendup_mbuf immediately.
6859 */
6860 if (mflag == M_WAITOK)
6861 return key_sendup_mbuf(NULL, result, KEY_SENDUP_REGISTERED);
6862 /*
6863 * XXX we cannot call key_sendup_mbuf directly here because
6864 * it can cause a deadlock:
6865 * - We have a reference to an SP (and an SA) here
6866 * - key_sendup_mbuf will try to take key_so_mtx
6867 * - Some other thread may try to localcount_drain to the SP with
6868 * holding key_so_mtx in say key_api_spdflush
6869 * - In this case localcount_drain never return because key_sendup_mbuf
6870 * that has stuck on key_so_mtx never release a reference to the SP
6871 *
6872 * So defer key_sendup_mbuf to the timer.
6873 */
6874 return key_acquire_sendup_mbuf_later(result);
6875
6876 fail:
6877 if (result)
6878 m_freem(result);
6879 return error;
6880}
6881
6882static struct mbuf *key_acquire_mbuf_head = NULL;
6883static unsigned key_acquire_mbuf_count = 0;
6884#define KEY_ACQUIRE_MBUF_MAX 10
6885
6886static void
6887key_acquire_sendup_pending_mbuf(void)
6888{
6889 struct mbuf *m, *prev;
6890 int error;
6891
6892again:
6893 prev = NULL;
6894 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
6895 m = key_acquire_mbuf_head;
6896 /* Get an earliest mbuf (one at the tail of the list) */
6897 while (m != NULL) {
6898 if (m->m_nextpkt == NULL) {
6899 if (prev != NULL)
6900 prev->m_nextpkt = NULL;
6901 if (m == key_acquire_mbuf_head)
6902 key_acquire_mbuf_head = NULL;
6903 key_acquire_mbuf_count--;
6904 break;
6905 }
6906 prev = m;
6907 m = m->m_nextpkt;
6908 }
6909 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
6910
6911 if (m == NULL)
6912 return;
6913
6914 m->m_nextpkt = NULL;
6915 error = key_sendup_mbuf(NULL, m, KEY_SENDUP_REGISTERED);
6916 if (error != 0)
6917 IPSECLOG(LOG_WARNING, "key_sendup_mbuf failed (error=%d)\n",
6918 error);
6919
6920 if (prev != NULL)
6921 goto again;
6922}
6923
6924static int
6925key_acquire_sendup_mbuf_later(struct mbuf *m)
6926{
6927
6928 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
6929 /* Avoid queuing too much mbufs */
6930 if (key_acquire_mbuf_count >= KEY_ACQUIRE_MBUF_MAX) {
6931 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
6932 m_freem(m);
6933 return ENOBUFS; /* XXX */
6934 }
6935 /* Enqueue mbuf at the head of the list */
6936 m->m_nextpkt = key_acquire_mbuf_head;
6937 key_acquire_mbuf_head = m;
6938 key_acquire_mbuf_count++;
6939 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
6940
6941 /* Kick the timer */
6942 key_timehandler(NULL);
6943
6944 return 0;
6945}
6946
6947#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
6948static struct secacq *
6949key_newacq(const struct secasindex *saidx)
6950{
6951 struct secacq *newacq;
6952
6953 /* get new entry */
6954 newacq = kmem_intr_zalloc(sizeof(struct secacq), KM_NOSLEEP);
6955 if (newacq == NULL) {
6956 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
6957 return NULL;
6958 }
6959
6960 /* copy secindex */
6961 memcpy(&newacq->saidx, saidx, sizeof(newacq->saidx));
6962 newacq->seq = (acq_seq == ~0 ? 1 : ++acq_seq);
6963 newacq->created = time_uptime;
6964 newacq->count = 0;
6965
6966 return newacq;
6967}
6968
6969static struct secacq *
6970key_getacq(const struct secasindex *saidx)
6971{
6972 struct secacq *acq;
6973
6974 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_misc.lock));
6975
6976 LIST_FOREACH(acq, &key_misc.acqlist, chain) {
6977 if (key_saidx_match(saidx, &acq->saidx, CMP_EXACTLY))
6978 return acq;
6979 }
6980
6981 return NULL;
6982}
6983
6984static struct secacq *
6985key_getacqbyseq(u_int32_t seq)
6986{
6987 struct secacq *acq;
6988
6989 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_misc.lock));
6990
6991 LIST_FOREACH(acq, &key_misc.acqlist, chain) {
6992 if (acq->seq == seq)
6993 return acq;
6994 }
6995
6996 return NULL;
6997}
6998#endif
6999
7000#ifdef notyet
7001static struct secspacq *
7002key_newspacq(const struct secpolicyindex *spidx)
7003{
7004 struct secspacq *acq;
7005
7006 /* get new entry */
7007 acq = kmem_intr_zalloc(sizeof(struct secspacq), KM_NOSLEEP);
7008 if (acq == NULL) {
7009 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
7010 return NULL;
7011 }
7012
7013 /* copy secindex */
7014 memcpy(&acq->spidx, spidx, sizeof(acq->spidx));
7015 acq->created = time_uptime;
7016 acq->count = 0;
7017
7018 return acq;
7019}
7020
7021static struct secspacq *
7022key_getspacq(const struct secpolicyindex *spidx)
7023{
7024 struct secspacq *acq;
7025
7026 LIST_FOREACH(acq, &key_misc.spacqlist, chain) {
7027 if (key_spidx_match_exactly(spidx, &acq->spidx))
7028 return acq;
7029 }
7030
7031 return NULL;
7032}
7033#endif /* notyet */
7034
7035/*
7036 * SADB_ACQUIRE processing,
7037 * in first situation, is receiving
7038 * <base>
7039 * from the ikmpd, and clear sequence of its secasvar entry.
7040 *
7041 * In second situation, is receiving
7042 * <base, address(SD), (address(P),) (identity(SD),) (sensitivity,) proposal>
7043 * from a user land process, and return
7044 * <base, address(SD), (address(P),) (identity(SD),) (sensitivity,) proposal>
7045 * to the socket.
7046 *
7047 * m will always be freed.
7048 */
7049static int
7050key_api_acquire(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
7051 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
7052{
7053 const struct sockaddr *src, *dst;
7054 struct secasindex saidx;
7055 u_int16_t proto;
7056 int error;
7057
7058 /*
7059 * Error message from KMd.
7060 * We assume that if error was occurred in IKEd, the length of PFKEY
7061 * message is equal to the size of sadb_msg structure.
7062 * We do not raise error even if error occurred in this function.
7063 */
7064 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_len == PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(struct sadb_msg))) {
7065#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
7066 struct secacq *acq;
7067
7068 /* check sequence number */
7069 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq == 0) {
7070 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "must specify sequence number.\n");
7071 m_freem(m);
7072 return 0;
7073 }
7074
7075 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
7076 acq = key_getacqbyseq(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_seq);
7077 if (acq == NULL) {
7078 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
7079 /*
7080 * the specified larval SA is already gone, or we got
7081 * a bogus sequence number. we can silently ignore it.
7082 */
7083 m_freem(m);
7084 return 0;
7085 }
7086
7087 /* reset acq counter in order to deletion by timehander. */
7088 acq->created = time_uptime;
7089 acq->count = 0;
7090 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
7091#endif
7092 m_freem(m);
7093 return 0;
7094 }
7095
7096 /*
7097 * This message is from user land.
7098 */
7099
7100 /* map satype to proto */
7101 proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype);
7102 if (proto == 0) {
7103 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
7104 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7105 }
7106
7107 if (mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] == NULL ||
7108 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] == NULL ||
7109 mhp->ext[SADB_EXT_PROPOSAL] == NULL) {
7110 /* error */
7111 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
7112 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7113 }
7114 if (mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
7115 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] < sizeof(struct sadb_address) ||
7116 mhp->extlen[SADB_EXT_PROPOSAL] < sizeof(struct sadb_prop)) {
7117 /* error */
7118 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message is passed.\n");
7119 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7120 }
7121
7122 src = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
7123 dst = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(mhp, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
7124
7125 error = key_setsecasidx(proto, IPSEC_MODE_ANY, 0, src, dst, &saidx);
7126 if (error != 0)
7127 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7128
7129 error = key_set_natt_ports(&saidx.src, &saidx.dst, mhp);
7130 if (error != 0)
7131 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7132
7133 /* get a SA index */
7134 {
7135 struct secashead *sah;
7136 int s = pserialize_read_enter();
7137
7138 sah = key_getsah(&saidx, CMP_MODE_REQID);
7139 if (sah != NULL) {
7140 pserialize_read_exit(s);
7141 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "a SA exists already.\n");
7142 return key_senderror(so, m, EEXIST);
7143 }
7144 pserialize_read_exit(s);
7145 }
7146
7147 error = key_acquire(&saidx, NULL, M_WAITOK);
7148 if (error != 0) {
7149 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "error %d returned from key_acquire.\n",
7150 error);
7151 return key_senderror(so, m, error);
7152 }
7153
7154 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, m, KEY_SENDUP_REGISTERED);
7155}
7156
7157/*
7158 * SADB_REGISTER processing.
7159 * If SATYPE_UNSPEC has been passed as satype, only return sabd_supported.
7160 * receive
7161 * <base>
7162 * from the ikmpd, and register a socket to send PF_KEY messages,
7163 * and send
7164 * <base, supported>
7165 * to KMD by PF_KEY.
7166 * If socket is detached, must free from regnode.
7167 *
7168 * m will always be freed.
7169 */
7170static int
7171key_api_register(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
7172 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
7173{
7174 struct secreg *reg, *newreg = 0;
7175
7176 /* check for invalid register message */
7177 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype >= __arraycount(key_misc.reglist))
7178 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7179
7180 /* When SATYPE_UNSPEC is specified, only return sabd_supported. */
7181 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype == SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC)
7182 goto setmsg;
7183
7184 /* Allocate regnode in advance, out of mutex */
7185 newreg = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(*newreg), KM_SLEEP);
7186
7187 /* check whether existing or not */
7188 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
7189 LIST_FOREACH(reg, &key_misc.reglist[mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype], chain) {
7190 if (reg->so == so) {
7191 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "socket exists already.\n");
7192 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
7193 kmem_free(newreg, sizeof(*newreg));
7194 return key_senderror(so, m, EEXIST);
7195 }
7196 }
7197
7198 newreg->so = so;
7199 ((struct keycb *)sotorawcb(so))->kp_registered++;
7200
7201 /* add regnode to key_misc.reglist. */
7202 LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&key_misc.reglist[mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype], newreg, chain);
7203 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
7204
7205 setmsg:
7206 {
7207 struct mbuf *n;
7208 struct sadb_supported *sup;
7209 u_int len, alen, elen;
7210 int off;
7211 int i;
7212 struct sadb_alg *alg;
7213
7214 /* create new sadb_msg to reply. */
7215 alen = 0;
7216 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_AALG_MAX; i++) {
7217 if (ah_algorithm_lookup(i))
7218 alen += sizeof(struct sadb_alg);
7219 }
7220 if (alen)
7221 alen += sizeof(struct sadb_supported);
7222 elen = 0;
7223 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_EALG_MAX; i++) {
7224 if (esp_algorithm_lookup(i))
7225 elen += sizeof(struct sadb_alg);
7226 }
7227 if (elen)
7228 elen += sizeof(struct sadb_supported);
7229
7230 len = sizeof(struct sadb_msg) + alen + elen;
7231
7232 if (len > MCLBYTES)
7233 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOBUFS);
7234
7235 n = key_alloc_mbuf_simple(len, M_WAITOK);
7236 n->m_pkthdr.len = n->m_len = len;
7237 n->m_next = NULL;
7238 off = 0;
7239
7240 m_copydata(m, 0, sizeof(struct sadb_msg), mtod(n, char *) + off);
7241 key_fill_replymsg(n, 0);
7242
7243 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
7244
7245 /* for authentication algorithm */
7246 if (alen) {
7247 sup = (struct sadb_supported *)(mtod(n, char *) + off);
7248 sup->sadb_supported_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(alen);
7249 sup->sadb_supported_exttype = SADB_EXT_SUPPORTED_AUTH;
7250 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(*sup));
7251
7252 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_AALG_MAX; i++) {
7253 const struct auth_hash *aalgo;
7254 u_int16_t minkeysize, maxkeysize;
7255
7256 aalgo = ah_algorithm_lookup(i);
7257 if (!aalgo)
7258 continue;
7259 alg = (struct sadb_alg *)(mtod(n, char *) + off);
7260 alg->sadb_alg_id = i;
7261 alg->sadb_alg_ivlen = 0;
7262 key_getsizes_ah(aalgo, i, &minkeysize, &maxkeysize);
7263 alg->sadb_alg_minbits = _BITS(minkeysize);
7264 alg->sadb_alg_maxbits = _BITS(maxkeysize);
7265 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(*alg));
7266 }
7267 }
7268
7269 /* for encryption algorithm */
7270 if (elen) {
7271 sup = (struct sadb_supported *)(mtod(n, char *) + off);
7272 sup->sadb_supported_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(elen);
7273 sup->sadb_supported_exttype = SADB_EXT_SUPPORTED_ENCRYPT;
7274 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(*sup));
7275
7276 for (i = 1; i <= SADB_EALG_MAX; i++) {
7277 const struct enc_xform *ealgo;
7278
7279 ealgo = esp_algorithm_lookup(i);
7280 if (!ealgo)
7281 continue;
7282 alg = (struct sadb_alg *)(mtod(n, char *) + off);
7283 alg->sadb_alg_id = i;
7284 alg->sadb_alg_ivlen = ealgo->blocksize;
7285 alg->sadb_alg_minbits = _BITS(ealgo->minkey);
7286 alg->sadb_alg_maxbits = _BITS(ealgo->maxkey);
7287 off += PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_alg));
7288 }
7289 }
7290
7291 KASSERTMSG(off == len, "length inconsistency");
7292
7293 m_freem(m);
7294 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, n, KEY_SENDUP_REGISTERED);
7295 }
7296}
7297
7298/*
7299 * free secreg entry registered.
7300 * XXX: I want to do free a socket marked done SADB_RESIGER to socket.
7301 */
7302void
7303key_freereg(struct socket *so)
7304{
7305 struct secreg *reg;
7306 int i;
7307
7308 KASSERT(!cpu_softintr_p());
7309 KASSERT(so != NULL);
7310
7311 /*
7312 * check whether existing or not.
7313 * check all type of SA, because there is a potential that
7314 * one socket is registered to multiple type of SA.
7315 */
7316 for (i = 0; i <= SADB_SATYPE_MAX; i++) {
7317 mutex_enter(&key_misc.lock);
7318 LIST_FOREACH(reg, &key_misc.reglist[i], chain) {
7319 if (reg->so == so) {
7320 LIST_REMOVE(reg, chain);
7321 break;
7322 }
7323 }
7324 mutex_exit(&key_misc.lock);
7325 if (reg != NULL)
7326 kmem_free(reg, sizeof(*reg));
7327 }
7328
7329 return;
7330}
7331
7332/*
7333 * SADB_EXPIRE processing
7334 * send
7335 * <base, SA, SA2, lifetime(C and one of HS), address(SD)>
7336 * to KMD by PF_KEY.
7337 * NOTE: We send only soft lifetime extension.
7338 *
7339 * OUT: 0 : succeed
7340 * others : error number
7341 */
7342static int
7343key_expire(struct secasvar *sav)
7344{
7345 int s;
7346 int satype;
7347 struct mbuf *result = NULL, *m;
7348 int len;
7349 int error = -1;
7350 struct sadb_lifetime *lt;
7351 lifetime_counters_t sum = {0};
7352
7353 /* XXX: Why do we lock ? */
7354 s = splsoftnet(); /*called from softclock()*/
7355
7356 KASSERT(sav != NULL);
7357
7358 satype = key_proto2satype(sav->sah->saidx.proto);
7359 KASSERTMSG(satype != 0, "invalid proto is passed");
7360
7361 /* set msg header */
7362 m = key_setsadbmsg(SADB_EXPIRE, 0, satype, sav->seq, 0, key_sa_refcnt(sav),
7363 M_WAITOK);
7364 result = m;
7365
7366 /* create SA extension */
7367 m = key_setsadbsa(sav);
7368 m_cat(result, m);
7369
7370 /* create SA extension */
7371 m = key_setsadbxsa2(sav->sah->saidx.mode,
7372 sav->replay ? sav->replay->count : 0, sav->sah->saidx.reqid);
7373 m_cat(result, m);
7374
7375 /* create lifetime extension (current and soft) */
7376 len = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(*lt)) * 2;
7377 m = key_alloc_mbuf(len, M_WAITOK);
7378 KASSERT(m->m_next == NULL);
7379
7380 memset(mtod(m, void *), 0, len);
7381 lt = mtod(m, struct sadb_lifetime *);
7382 lt->sadb_lifetime_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(sizeof(struct sadb_lifetime));
7383 lt->sadb_lifetime_exttype = SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_CURRENT;
7384 percpu_foreach(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu,
7385 key_sum_lifetime_counters, sum);
7386 lt->sadb_lifetime_allocations = sum[LIFETIME_COUNTER_ALLOCATIONS];
7387 lt->sadb_lifetime_bytes = sum[LIFETIME_COUNTER_BYTES];
7388 lt->sadb_lifetime_addtime =
7389 time_mono_to_wall(sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_addtime);
7390 lt->sadb_lifetime_usetime =
7391 time_mono_to_wall(sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_usetime);
7392 lt = (struct sadb_lifetime *)(mtod(m, char *) + len / 2);
7393 memcpy(lt, sav->lft_s, sizeof(*lt));
7394 m_cat(result, m);
7395
7396 /* set sadb_address for source */
7397 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC, &sav->sah->saidx.src.sa,
7398 FULLMASK, IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, M_WAITOK);
7399 m_cat(result, m);
7400
7401 /* set sadb_address for destination */
7402 m = key_setsadbaddr(SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST, &sav->sah->saidx.dst.sa,
7403 FULLMASK, IPSEC_ULPROTO_ANY, M_WAITOK);
7404 m_cat(result, m);
7405
7406 if ((result->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) == 0) {
7407 error = EINVAL;
7408 goto fail;
7409 }
7410
7411 if (result->m_len < sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) {
7412 result = m_pullup(result, sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
7413 if (result == NULL) {
7414 error = ENOBUFS;
7415 goto fail;
7416 }
7417 }
7418
7419 result->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
7420 for (m = result; m; m = m->m_next)
7421 result->m_pkthdr.len += m->m_len;
7422
7423 mtod(result, struct sadb_msg *)->sadb_msg_len =
7424 PFKEY_UNIT64(result->m_pkthdr.len);
7425
7426 splx(s);
7427 return key_sendup_mbuf(NULL, result, KEY_SENDUP_REGISTERED);
7428
7429 fail:
7430 if (result)
7431 m_freem(result);
7432 splx(s);
7433 return error;
7434}
7435
7436/*
7437 * SADB_FLUSH processing
7438 * receive
7439 * <base>
7440 * from the ikmpd, and free all entries in secastree.
7441 * and send,
7442 * <base>
7443 * to the ikmpd.
7444 * NOTE: to do is only marking SADB_SASTATE_DEAD.
7445 *
7446 * m will always be freed.
7447 */
7448static int
7449key_api_flush(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
7450 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
7451{
7452 struct sadb_msg *newmsg;
7453 struct secashead *sah;
7454 struct secasvar *sav;
7455 u_int16_t proto;
7456 u_int8_t state;
7457 int s;
7458
7459 /* map satype to proto */
7460 proto = key_satype2proto(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype);
7461 if (proto == 0) {
7462 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
7463 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7464 }
7465
7466 /* no SATYPE specified, i.e. flushing all SA. */
7467 s = pserialize_read_enter();
7468 SAHLIST_READER_FOREACH(sah) {
7469 if (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype != SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC &&
7470 proto != sah->saidx.proto)
7471 continue;
7472
7473 key_sah_ref(sah);
7474 pserialize_read_exit(s);
7475
7476 SASTATE_ALIVE_FOREACH(state) {
7477 restart:
7478 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
7479 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
7480 sav->state = SADB_SASTATE_DEAD;
7481 key_unlink_sav(sav);
7482 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
7483 key_destroy_sav(sav);
7484 goto restart;
7485 }
7486 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
7487 }
7488
7489 s = pserialize_read_enter();
7490 sah->state = SADB_SASTATE_DEAD;
7491 key_sah_unref(sah);
7492 }
7493 pserialize_read_exit(s);
7494
7495 if (m->m_len < sizeof(struct sadb_msg) ||
7496 sizeof(struct sadb_msg) > m->m_len + M_TRAILINGSPACE(m)) {
7497 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "No more memory.\n");
7498 return key_senderror(so, m, ENOBUFS);
7499 }
7500
7501 if (m->m_next)
7502 m_freem(m->m_next);
7503 m->m_next = NULL;
7504 m->m_pkthdr.len = m->m_len = sizeof(struct sadb_msg);
7505 newmsg = mtod(m, struct sadb_msg *);
7506 newmsg->sadb_msg_errno = 0;
7507 newmsg->sadb_msg_len = PFKEY_UNIT64(m->m_pkthdr.len);
7508
7509 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, m, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
7510}
7511
7512
7513static struct mbuf *
7514key_setdump_chain(u_int8_t req_satype, int *errorp, int *lenp, pid_t pid)
7515{
7516 struct secashead *sah;
7517 struct secasvar *sav;
7518 u_int16_t proto;
7519 u_int8_t satype;
7520 u_int8_t state;
7521 int cnt;
7522 struct mbuf *m, *n, *prev;
7523
7524 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_sad.lock));
7525
7526 *lenp = 0;
7527
7528 /* map satype to proto */
7529 proto = key_satype2proto(req_satype);
7530 if (proto == 0) {
7531 *errorp = EINVAL;
7532 return (NULL);
7533 }
7534
7535 /* count sav entries to be sent to userland. */
7536 cnt = 0;
7537 SAHLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sah) {
7538 if (req_satype != SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC &&
7539 proto != sah->saidx.proto)
7540 continue;
7541
7542 SASTATE_ANY_FOREACH(state) {
7543 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
7544 cnt++;
7545 }
7546 }
7547 }
7548
7549 if (cnt == 0) {
7550 *errorp = ENOENT;
7551 return (NULL);
7552 }
7553
7554 /* send this to the userland, one at a time. */
7555 m = NULL;
7556 prev = m;
7557 SAHLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sah) {
7558 if (req_satype != SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC &&
7559 proto != sah->saidx.proto)
7560 continue;
7561
7562 /* map proto to satype */
7563 satype = key_proto2satype(sah->saidx.proto);
7564 if (satype == 0) {
7565 m_freem(m);
7566 *errorp = EINVAL;
7567 return (NULL);
7568 }
7569
7570 SASTATE_ANY_FOREACH(state) {
7571 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
7572 n = key_setdumpsa(sav, SADB_DUMP, satype,
7573 --cnt, pid);
7574 if (!m)
7575 m = n;
7576 else
7577 prev->m_nextpkt = n;
7578 prev = n;
7579 }
7580 }
7581 }
7582
7583 if (!m) {
7584 *errorp = EINVAL;
7585 return (NULL);
7586 }
7587
7588 if ((m->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) != 0) {
7589 m->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
7590 for (n = m; n; n = n->m_next)
7591 m->m_pkthdr.len += n->m_len;
7592 }
7593
7594 *errorp = 0;
7595 return (m);
7596}
7597
7598/*
7599 * SADB_DUMP processing
7600 * dump all entries including status of DEAD in SAD.
7601 * receive
7602 * <base>
7603 * from the ikmpd, and dump all secasvar leaves
7604 * and send,
7605 * <base> .....
7606 * to the ikmpd.
7607 *
7608 * m will always be freed.
7609 */
7610static int
7611key_api_dump(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m0,
7612 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
7613{
7614 u_int16_t proto;
7615 u_int8_t satype;
7616 struct mbuf *n;
7617 int error, len, ok;
7618
7619 /* map satype to proto */
7620 satype = mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype;
7621 proto = key_satype2proto(satype);
7622 if (proto == 0) {
7623 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid satype is passed.\n");
7624 return key_senderror(so, m0, EINVAL);
7625 }
7626
7627 /*
7628 * If the requestor has insufficient socket-buffer space
7629 * for the entire chain, nobody gets any response to the DUMP.
7630 * XXX For now, only the requestor ever gets anything.
7631 * Moreover, if the requestor has any space at all, they receive
7632 * the entire chain, otherwise the request is refused with ENOBUFS.
7633 */
7634 if (sbspace(&so->so_rcv) <= 0) {
7635 return key_senderror(so, m0, ENOBUFS);
7636 }
7637
7638 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
7639 n = key_setdump_chain(satype, &error, &len, mhp->msg->sadb_msg_pid);
7640 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
7641
7642 if (n == NULL) {
7643 return key_senderror(so, m0, ENOENT);
7644 }
7645 {
7646 uint64_t *ps = PFKEY_STAT_GETREF();
7647 ps[PFKEY_STAT_IN_TOTAL]++;
7648 ps[PFKEY_STAT_IN_BYTES] += len;
7649 PFKEY_STAT_PUTREF();
7650 }
7651
7652 /*
7653 * PF_KEY DUMP responses are no longer broadcast to all PF_KEY sockets.
7654 * The requestor receives either the entire chain, or an
7655 * error message with ENOBUFS.
7656 *
7657 * sbappendaddrchain() takes the chain of entries, one
7658 * packet-record per SPD entry, prepends the key_src sockaddr
7659 * to each packet-record, links the sockaddr mbufs into a new
7660 * list of records, then appends the entire resulting
7661 * list to the requesting socket.
7662 */
7663 ok = sbappendaddrchain(&so->so_rcv, (struct sockaddr *)&key_src, n,
7664 SB_PRIO_ONESHOT_OVERFLOW);
7665
7666 if (!ok) {
7667 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_IN_NOMEM);
7668 m_freem(n);
7669 return key_senderror(so, m0, ENOBUFS);
7670 }
7671
7672 m_freem(m0);
7673 return 0;
7674}
7675
7676/*
7677 * SADB_X_PROMISC processing
7678 *
7679 * m will always be freed.
7680 */
7681static int
7682key_api_promisc(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m,
7683 const struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
7684{
7685 int olen;
7686
7687 olen = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_len);
7688
7689 if (olen < sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) {
7690#if 1
7691 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7692#else
7693 m_freem(m);
7694 return 0;
7695#endif
7696 } else if (olen == sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) {
7697 /* enable/disable promisc mode */
7698 struct keycb *kp = (struct keycb *)sotorawcb(so);
7699 if (kp == NULL)
7700 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7701 mhp->msg->sadb_msg_errno = 0;
7702 switch (mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype) {
7703 case 0:
7704 case 1:
7705 kp->kp_promisc = mhp->msg->sadb_msg_satype;
7706 break;
7707 default:
7708 return key_senderror(so, m, EINVAL);
7709 }
7710
7711 /* send the original message back to everyone */
7712 mhp->msg->sadb_msg_errno = 0;
7713 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, m, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
7714 } else {
7715 /* send packet as is */
7716
7717 m_adj(m, PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_msg)));
7718
7719 /* TODO: if sadb_msg_seq is specified, send to specific pid */
7720 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, m, KEY_SENDUP_ALL);
7721 }
7722}
7723
7724static int (*key_api_typesw[]) (struct socket *, struct mbuf *,
7725 const struct sadb_msghdr *) = {
7726 NULL, /* SADB_RESERVED */
7727 key_api_getspi, /* SADB_GETSPI */
7728 key_api_update, /* SADB_UPDATE */
7729 key_api_add, /* SADB_ADD */
7730 key_api_delete, /* SADB_DELETE */
7731 key_api_get, /* SADB_GET */
7732 key_api_acquire, /* SADB_ACQUIRE */
7733 key_api_register, /* SADB_REGISTER */
7734 NULL, /* SADB_EXPIRE */
7735 key_api_flush, /* SADB_FLUSH */
7736 key_api_dump, /* SADB_DUMP */
7737 key_api_promisc, /* SADB_X_PROMISC */
7738 NULL, /* SADB_X_PCHANGE */
7739 key_api_spdadd, /* SADB_X_SPDUPDATE */
7740 key_api_spdadd, /* SADB_X_SPDADD */
7741 key_api_spddelete, /* SADB_X_SPDDELETE */
7742 key_api_spdget, /* SADB_X_SPDGET */
7743 NULL, /* SADB_X_SPDACQUIRE */
7744 key_api_spddump, /* SADB_X_SPDDUMP */
7745 key_api_spdflush, /* SADB_X_SPDFLUSH */
7746 key_api_spdadd, /* SADB_X_SPDSETIDX */
7747 NULL, /* SADB_X_SPDEXPIRE */
7748 key_api_spddelete2, /* SADB_X_SPDDELETE2 */
7749 key_api_nat_map, /* SADB_X_NAT_T_NEW_MAPPING */
7750};
7751
7752/*
7753 * parse sadb_msg buffer to process PFKEYv2,
7754 * and create a data to response if needed.
7755 * I think to be dealed with mbuf directly.
7756 * IN:
7757 * msgp : pointer to pointer to a received buffer pulluped.
7758 * This is rewrited to response.
7759 * so : pointer to socket.
7760 * OUT:
7761 * length for buffer to send to user process.
7762 */
7763int
7764key_parse(struct mbuf *m, struct socket *so)
7765{
7766 struct sadb_msg *msg;
7767 struct sadb_msghdr mh;
7768 u_int orglen;
7769 int error;
7770
7771 KASSERT(m != NULL);
7772 KASSERT(so != NULL);
7773
7774#if 0 /*kdebug_sadb assumes msg in linear buffer*/
7775 if (KEYDEBUG_ON(KEYDEBUG_KEY_DUMP)) {
7776 kdebug_sadb("passed sadb_msg", msg);
7777 }
7778#endif
7779
7780 if (m->m_len < sizeof(struct sadb_msg)) {
7781 m = m_pullup(m, sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
7782 if (!m)
7783 return ENOBUFS;
7784 }
7785 msg = mtod(m, struct sadb_msg *);
7786 orglen = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(msg->sadb_msg_len);
7787
7788 if ((m->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) == 0 ||
7789 m->m_pkthdr.len != orglen) {
7790 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid message length.\n");
7791 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVLEN);
7792 error = EINVAL;
7793 goto senderror;
7794 }
7795
7796 if (msg->sadb_msg_version != PF_KEY_V2) {
7797 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "PF_KEY version %u is mismatched.\n",
7798 msg->sadb_msg_version);
7799 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVVER);
7800 error = EINVAL;
7801 goto senderror;
7802 }
7803
7804 if (msg->sadb_msg_type > SADB_MAX) {
7805 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid type %u is passed.\n",
7806 msg->sadb_msg_type);
7807 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVMSGTYPE);
7808 error = EINVAL;
7809 goto senderror;
7810 }
7811
7812 /* for old-fashioned code - should be nuked */
7813 if (m->m_pkthdr.len > MCLBYTES) {
7814 m_freem(m);
7815 return ENOBUFS;
7816 }
7817 if (m->m_next) {
7818 struct mbuf *n;
7819
7820 n = key_alloc_mbuf_simple(m->m_pkthdr.len, M_WAITOK);
7821
7822 m_copydata(m, 0, m->m_pkthdr.len, mtod(n, void *));
7823 n->m_pkthdr.len = n->m_len = m->m_pkthdr.len;
7824 n->m_next = NULL;
7825 m_freem(m);
7826 m = n;
7827 }
7828
7829 /* align the mbuf chain so that extensions are in contiguous region. */
7830 error = key_align(m, &mh);
7831 if (error)
7832 return error;
7833
7834 if (m->m_next) { /*XXX*/
7835 m_freem(m);
7836 return ENOBUFS;
7837 }
7838
7839 msg = mh.msg;
7840
7841 /* check SA type */
7842 switch (msg->sadb_msg_satype) {
7843 case SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC:
7844 switch (msg->sadb_msg_type) {
7845 case SADB_GETSPI:
7846 case SADB_UPDATE:
7847 case SADB_ADD:
7848 case SADB_DELETE:
7849 case SADB_GET:
7850 case SADB_ACQUIRE:
7851 case SADB_EXPIRE:
7852 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
7853 "must specify satype when msg type=%u.\n",
7854 msg->sadb_msg_type);
7855 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVSATYPE);
7856 error = EINVAL;
7857 goto senderror;
7858 }
7859 break;
7860 case SADB_SATYPE_AH:
7861 case SADB_SATYPE_ESP:
7862 case SADB_X_SATYPE_IPCOMP:
7863 case SADB_X_SATYPE_TCPSIGNATURE:
7864 switch (msg->sadb_msg_type) {
7865 case SADB_X_SPDADD:
7866 case SADB_X_SPDDELETE:
7867 case SADB_X_SPDGET:
7868 case SADB_X_SPDDUMP:
7869 case SADB_X_SPDFLUSH:
7870 case SADB_X_SPDSETIDX:
7871 case SADB_X_SPDUPDATE:
7872 case SADB_X_SPDDELETE2:
7873 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "illegal satype=%u\n",
7874 msg->sadb_msg_type);
7875 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVSATYPE);
7876 error = EINVAL;
7877 goto senderror;
7878 }
7879 break;
7880 case SADB_SATYPE_RSVP:
7881 case SADB_SATYPE_OSPFV2:
7882 case SADB_SATYPE_RIPV2:
7883 case SADB_SATYPE_MIP:
7884 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "type %u isn't supported.\n",
7885 msg->sadb_msg_satype);
7886 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVSATYPE);
7887 error = EOPNOTSUPP;
7888 goto senderror;
7889 case 1: /* XXX: What does it do? */
7890 if (msg->sadb_msg_type == SADB_X_PROMISC)
7891 break;
7892 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
7893 default:
7894 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid type %u is passed.\n",
7895 msg->sadb_msg_satype);
7896 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVSATYPE);
7897 error = EINVAL;
7898 goto senderror;
7899 }
7900
7901 /* check field of upper layer protocol and address family */
7902 if (mh.ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC] != NULL &&
7903 mh.ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST] != NULL) {
7904 const struct sadb_address *src0, *dst0;
7905 const struct sockaddr *sa0, *da0;
7906 u_int plen;
7907
7908 src0 = mh.ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC];
7909 dst0 = mh.ext[SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST];
7910 sa0 = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(&mh, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC);
7911 da0 = key_msghdr_get_sockaddr(&mh, SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST);
7912
7913 /* check upper layer protocol */
7914 if (src0->sadb_address_proto != dst0->sadb_address_proto) {
7915 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
7916 "upper layer protocol mismatched src %u, dst %u.\n",
7917 src0->sadb_address_proto, dst0->sadb_address_proto);
7918
7919 goto invaddr;
7920 }
7921
7922 /* check family */
7923 if (sa0->sa_family != da0->sa_family) {
7924 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
7925 "address family mismatched src %u, dst %u.\n",
7926 sa0->sa_family, da0->sa_family);
7927 goto invaddr;
7928 }
7929 if (sa0->sa_len != da0->sa_len) {
7930 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
7931 "address size mismatched src %u, dst %u.\n",
7932 sa0->sa_len, da0->sa_len);
7933 goto invaddr;
7934 }
7935
7936 switch (sa0->sa_family) {
7937 case AF_INET:
7938 if (sa0->sa_len != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) {
7939 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
7940 "address size mismatched %u != %zu.\n",
7941 sa0->sa_len, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
7942 goto invaddr;
7943 }
7944 break;
7945 case AF_INET6:
7946 if (sa0->sa_len != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6)) {
7947 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
7948 "address size mismatched %u != %zu.\n",
7949 sa0->sa_len, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6));
7950 goto invaddr;
7951 }
7952 break;
7953 default:
7954 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "unsupported address family %u.\n",
7955 sa0->sa_family);
7956 error = EAFNOSUPPORT;
7957 goto senderror;
7958 }
7959 plen = key_sabits(sa0);
7960
7961 /* check max prefix length */
7962 if (src0->sadb_address_prefixlen > plen ||
7963 dst0->sadb_address_prefixlen > plen) {
7964 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "illegal prefixlen.\n");
7965 goto invaddr;
7966 }
7967
7968 /*
7969 * prefixlen == 0 is valid because there can be a case when
7970 * all addresses are matched.
7971 */
7972 }
7973
7974 if (msg->sadb_msg_type >= __arraycount(key_api_typesw) ||
7975 key_api_typesw[msg->sadb_msg_type] == NULL) {
7976 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVMSGTYPE);
7977 error = EINVAL;
7978 goto senderror;
7979 }
7980
7981 return (*key_api_typesw[msg->sadb_msg_type])(so, m, &mh);
7982
7983invaddr:
7984 error = EINVAL;
7985senderror:
7986 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVADDR);
7987 return key_senderror(so, m, error);
7988}
7989
7990static int
7991key_senderror(struct socket *so, struct mbuf *m, int code)
7992{
7993 struct sadb_msg *msg;
7994
7995 KASSERT(m->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
7996
7997 if (so == NULL) {
7998 /*
7999 * This means the request comes from kernel.
8000 * As the request comes from kernel, it is unnecessary to
8001 * send message to userland. Just return errcode directly.
8002 */
8003 m_freem(m);
8004 return code;
8005 }
8006
8007 msg = mtod(m, struct sadb_msg *);
8008 msg->sadb_msg_errno = code;
8009 return key_sendup_mbuf(so, m, KEY_SENDUP_ONE);
8010}
8011
8012/*
8013 * set the pointer to each header into message buffer.
8014 * m will be freed on error.
8015 * XXX larger-than-MCLBYTES extension?
8016 */
8017static int
8018key_align(struct mbuf *m, struct sadb_msghdr *mhp)
8019{
8020 struct mbuf *n;
8021 struct sadb_ext *ext;
8022 size_t off, end;
8023 int extlen;
8024 int toff;
8025
8026 KASSERT(m != NULL);
8027 KASSERT(mhp != NULL);
8028 KASSERT(m->m_len >= sizeof(struct sadb_msg));
8029
8030 /* initialize */
8031 memset(mhp, 0, sizeof(*mhp));
8032
8033 mhp->msg = mtod(m, struct sadb_msg *);
8034 mhp->ext[0] = mhp->msg; /*XXX backward compat */
8035
8036 end = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(mhp->msg->sadb_msg_len);
8037 extlen = end; /*just in case extlen is not updated*/
8038 for (off = sizeof(struct sadb_msg); off < end; off += extlen) {
8039 n = m_pulldown(m, off, sizeof(struct sadb_ext), &toff);
8040 if (!n) {
8041 /* m is already freed */
8042 return ENOBUFS;
8043 }
8044 ext = (struct sadb_ext *)(mtod(n, char *) + toff);
8045
8046 /* set pointer */
8047 switch (ext->sadb_ext_type) {
8048 case SADB_EXT_SA:
8049 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC:
8050 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST:
8051 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_PROXY:
8052 case SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_CURRENT:
8053 case SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_HARD:
8054 case SADB_EXT_LIFETIME_SOFT:
8055 case SADB_EXT_KEY_AUTH:
8056 case SADB_EXT_KEY_ENCRYPT:
8057 case SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC:
8058 case SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST:
8059 case SADB_EXT_SENSITIVITY:
8060 case SADB_EXT_PROPOSAL:
8061 case SADB_EXT_SUPPORTED_AUTH:
8062 case SADB_EXT_SUPPORTED_ENCRYPT:
8063 case SADB_EXT_SPIRANGE:
8064 case SADB_X_EXT_POLICY:
8065 case SADB_X_EXT_SA2:
8066 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_TYPE:
8067 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_SPORT:
8068 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_DPORT:
8069 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAI:
8070 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_OAR:
8071 case SADB_X_EXT_NAT_T_FRAG:
8072 /* duplicate check */
8073 /*
8074 * XXX Are there duplication payloads of either
8075 * KEY_AUTH or KEY_ENCRYPT ?
8076 */
8077 if (mhp->ext[ext->sadb_ext_type] != NULL) {
8078 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG,
8079 "duplicate ext_type %u is passed.\n",
8080 ext->sadb_ext_type);
8081 m_freem(m);
8082 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_DUPEXT);
8083 return EINVAL;
8084 }
8085 break;
8086 default:
8087 IPSECLOG(LOG_DEBUG, "invalid ext_type %u is passed.\n",
8088 ext->sadb_ext_type);
8089 m_freem(m);
8090 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVEXTTYPE);
8091 return EINVAL;
8092 }
8093
8094 extlen = PFKEY_UNUNIT64(ext->sadb_ext_len);
8095
8096 if (key_validate_ext(ext, extlen)) {
8097 m_freem(m);
8098 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVLEN);
8099 return EINVAL;
8100 }
8101
8102 n = m_pulldown(m, off, extlen, &toff);
8103 if (!n) {
8104 /* m is already freed */
8105 return ENOBUFS;
8106 }
8107 ext = (struct sadb_ext *)(mtod(n, char *) + toff);
8108
8109 mhp->ext[ext->sadb_ext_type] = ext;
8110 mhp->extoff[ext->sadb_ext_type] = off;
8111 mhp->extlen[ext->sadb_ext_type] = extlen;
8112 }
8113
8114 if (off != end) {
8115 m_freem(m);
8116 PFKEY_STATINC(PFKEY_STAT_OUT_INVLEN);
8117 return EINVAL;
8118 }
8119
8120 return 0;
8121}
8122
8123static int
8124key_validate_ext(const struct sadb_ext *ext, int len)
8125{
8126 const struct sockaddr *sa;
8127 enum { NONE, ADDR } checktype = NONE;
8128 int baselen = 0;
8129 const int sal = offsetof(struct sockaddr, sa_len) + sizeof(sa->sa_len);
8130
8131 if (len != PFKEY_UNUNIT64(ext->sadb_ext_len))
8132 return EINVAL;
8133
8134 /* if it does not match minimum/maximum length, bail */
8135 if (ext->sadb_ext_type >= __arraycount(minsize) ||
8136 ext->sadb_ext_type >= __arraycount(maxsize))
8137 return EINVAL;
8138 if (!minsize[ext->sadb_ext_type] || len < minsize[ext->sadb_ext_type])
8139 return EINVAL;
8140 if (maxsize[ext->sadb_ext_type] && len > maxsize[ext->sadb_ext_type])
8141 return EINVAL;
8142
8143 /* more checks based on sadb_ext_type XXX need more */
8144 switch (ext->sadb_ext_type) {
8145 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_SRC:
8146 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_DST:
8147 case SADB_EXT_ADDRESS_PROXY:
8148 baselen = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_address));
8149 checktype = ADDR;
8150 break;
8151 case SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_SRC:
8152 case SADB_EXT_IDENTITY_DST:
8153 if (((const struct sadb_ident *)ext)->sadb_ident_type ==
8154 SADB_X_IDENTTYPE_ADDR) {
8155 baselen = PFKEY_ALIGN8(sizeof(struct sadb_ident));
8156 checktype = ADDR;
8157 } else
8158 checktype = NONE;
8159 break;
8160 default:
8161 checktype = NONE;
8162 break;
8163 }
8164
8165 switch (checktype) {
8166 case NONE:
8167 break;
8168 case ADDR:
8169 sa = (const struct sockaddr *)(((const u_int8_t*)ext)+baselen);
8170 if (len < baselen + sal)
8171 return EINVAL;
8172 if (baselen + PFKEY_ALIGN8(sa->sa_len) != len)
8173 return EINVAL;
8174 break;
8175 }
8176
8177 return 0;
8178}
8179
8180static int
8181key_do_init(void)
8182{
8183 int i, error;
8184
8185 mutex_init(&key_misc.lock, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
8186
8187 mutex_init(&key_spd.lock, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
8188 cv_init(&key_spd.cv_lc, "key_sp_lc");
8189 key_spd.psz = pserialize_create();
8190 cv_init(&key_spd.cv_psz, "key_sp_psz");
8191 key_spd.psz_performing = false;
8192
8193 mutex_init(&key_sad.lock, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
8194 cv_init(&key_sad.cv_lc, "key_sa_lc");
8195 key_sad.psz = pserialize_create();
8196 cv_init(&key_sad.cv_psz, "key_sa_psz");
8197 key_sad.psz_performing = false;
8198
8199 pfkeystat_percpu = percpu_alloc(sizeof(uint64_t) * PFKEY_NSTATS);
8200
8201 callout_init(&key_timehandler_ch, CALLOUT_MPSAFE);
8202 error = workqueue_create(&key_timehandler_wq, "key_timehandler",
8203 key_timehandler_work, NULL, PRI_SOFTNET, IPL_SOFTNET, WQ_MPSAFE);
8204 if (error != 0)
8205 panic("%s: workqueue_create failed (%d)\n", __func__, error);
8206
8207 for (i = 0; i < IPSEC_DIR_MAX; i++) {
8208 PSLIST_INIT(&key_spd.splist[i]);
8209 }
8210
8211 PSLIST_INIT(&key_spd.socksplist);
8212
8213 key_sad.sahlists = hashinit(SAHHASH_NHASH, HASH_PSLIST, true,
8214 &key_sad.sahlistmask);
8215 key_sad.savlut = hashinit(SAVLUT_NHASH, HASH_PSLIST, true,
8216 &key_sad.savlutmask);
8217
8218 for (i = 0; i <= SADB_SATYPE_MAX; i++) {
8219 LIST_INIT(&key_misc.reglist[i]);
8220 }
8221
8222#ifndef IPSEC_NONBLOCK_ACQUIRE
8223 LIST_INIT(&key_misc.acqlist);
8224#endif
8225#ifdef notyet
8226 LIST_INIT(&key_misc.spacqlist);
8227#endif
8228
8229 /* system default */
8230 ip4_def_policy.policy = IPSEC_POLICY_NONE;
8231 ip4_def_policy.state = IPSEC_SPSTATE_ALIVE;
8232 localcount_init(&ip4_def_policy.localcount);
8233
8234#ifdef INET6
8235 ip6_def_policy.policy = IPSEC_POLICY_NONE;
8236 ip6_def_policy.state = IPSEC_SPSTATE_ALIVE;
8237 localcount_init(&ip6_def_policy.localcount);
8238#endif
8239
8240 callout_reset(&key_timehandler_ch, hz, key_timehandler, NULL);
8241
8242 /* initialize key statistics */
8243 keystat.getspi_count = 1;
8244
8245 aprint_verbose("IPsec: Initialized Security Association Processing.\n");
8246
8247 return (0);
8248}
8249
8250void
8251key_init(void)
8252{
8253 static ONCE_DECL(key_init_once);
8254
8255 sysctl_net_keyv2_setup(NULL);
8256 sysctl_net_key_compat_setup(NULL);
8257
8258 RUN_ONCE(&key_init_once, key_do_init);
8259
8260 key_init_so();
8261}
8262
8263/*
8264 * XXX: maybe This function is called after INBOUND IPsec processing.
8265 *
8266 * Special check for tunnel-mode packets.
8267 * We must make some checks for consistency between inner and outer IP header.
8268 *
8269 * xxx more checks to be provided
8270 */
8271int
8272key_checktunnelsanity(
8273 struct secasvar *sav,
8274 u_int family,
8275 void *src,
8276 void *dst
8277)
8278{
8279
8280 /* XXX: check inner IP header */
8281
8282 return 1;
8283}
8284
8285#if 0
8286#define hostnamelen strlen(hostname)
8287
8288/*
8289 * Get FQDN for the host.
8290 * If the administrator configured hostname (by hostname(1)) without
8291 * domain name, returns nothing.
8292 */
8293static const char *
8294key_getfqdn(void)
8295{
8296 int i;
8297 int hasdot;
8298 static char fqdn[MAXHOSTNAMELEN + 1];
8299
8300 if (!hostnamelen)
8301 return NULL;
8302
8303 /* check if it comes with domain name. */
8304 hasdot = 0;
8305 for (i = 0; i < hostnamelen; i++) {
8306 if (hostname[i] == '.')
8307 hasdot++;
8308 }
8309 if (!hasdot)
8310 return NULL;
8311
8312 /* NOTE: hostname may not be NUL-terminated. */
8313 memset(fqdn, 0, sizeof(fqdn));
8314 memcpy(fqdn, hostname, hostnamelen);
8315 fqdn[hostnamelen] = '\0';
8316 return fqdn;
8317}
8318
8319/*
8320 * get username@FQDN for the host/user.
8321 */
8322static const char *
8323key_getuserfqdn(void)
8324{
8325 const char *host;
8326 static char userfqdn[MAXHOSTNAMELEN + MAXLOGNAME + 2];
8327 struct proc *p = curproc;
8328 char *q;
8329
8330 if (!p || !p->p_pgrp || !p->p_pgrp->pg_session)
8331 return NULL;
8332 if (!(host = key_getfqdn()))
8333 return NULL;
8334
8335 /* NOTE: s_login may not be-NUL terminated. */
8336 memset(userfqdn, 0, sizeof(userfqdn));
8337 memcpy(userfqdn, Mp->p_pgrp->pg_session->s_login, AXLOGNAME);
8338 userfqdn[MAXLOGNAME] = '\0'; /* safeguard */
8339 q = userfqdn + strlen(userfqdn);
8340 *q++ = '@';
8341 memcpy(q, host, strlen(host));
8342 q += strlen(host);
8343 *q++ = '\0';
8344
8345 return userfqdn;
8346}
8347#endif
8348
8349/* record data transfer on SA, and update timestamps */
8350void
8351key_sa_recordxfer(struct secasvar *sav, struct mbuf *m)
8352{
8353 lifetime_counters_t *counters;
8354
8355 KASSERT(sav != NULL);
8356 KASSERT(sav->lft_c != NULL);
8357 KASSERT(m != NULL);
8358
8359 counters = percpu_getref(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu);
8360
8361 /*
8362 * XXX Currently, there is a difference of bytes size
8363 * between inbound and outbound processing.
8364 */
8365 (*counters)[LIFETIME_COUNTER_BYTES] += m->m_pkthdr.len;
8366 /* to check bytes lifetime is done in key_timehandler(). */
8367
8368 /*
8369 * We use the number of packets as the unit of
8370 * sadb_lifetime_allocations. We increment the variable
8371 * whenever {esp,ah}_{in,out}put is called.
8372 */
8373 (*counters)[LIFETIME_COUNTER_ALLOCATIONS]++;
8374 /* XXX check for expires? */
8375
8376 percpu_putref(sav->lft_c_counters_percpu);
8377
8378 /*
8379 * NOTE: We record CURRENT sadb_lifetime_usetime by using wall clock,
8380 * in seconds. HARD and SOFT lifetime are measured by the time
8381 * difference (again in seconds) from sadb_lifetime_usetime.
8382 *
8383 * usetime
8384 * v expire expire
8385 * -----+-----+--------+---> t
8386 * <--------------> HARD
8387 * <-----> SOFT
8388 */
8389 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_usetime = time_uptime;
8390 /* XXX check for expires? */
8391
8392 return;
8393}
8394
8395/* dumb version */
8396void
8397key_sa_routechange(struct sockaddr *dst)
8398{
8399 struct secashead *sah;
8400 int s;
8401
8402 s = pserialize_read_enter();
8403 SAHLIST_READER_FOREACH(sah) {
8404 struct route *ro;
8405 const struct sockaddr *sa;
8406
8407 key_sah_ref(sah);
8408 pserialize_read_exit(s);
8409
8410 ro = &sah->sa_route;
8411 sa = rtcache_getdst(ro);
8412 if (sa != NULL && dst->sa_len == sa->sa_len &&
8413 memcmp(dst, sa, dst->sa_len) == 0)
8414 rtcache_free(ro);
8415
8416 s = pserialize_read_enter();
8417 key_sah_unref(sah);
8418 }
8419 pserialize_read_exit(s);
8420
8421 return;
8422}
8423
8424static void
8425key_sa_chgstate(struct secasvar *sav, u_int8_t state)
8426{
8427 struct secasvar *_sav;
8428
8429 ASSERT_SLEEPABLE();
8430 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_sad.lock));
8431
8432 if (sav->state == state)
8433 return;
8434
8435 key_unlink_sav(sav);
8436 localcount_fini(&sav->localcount);
8437 SAVLIST_ENTRY_DESTROY(sav);
8438 key_init_sav(sav);
8439
8440 sav->state = state;
8441 if (!SADB_SASTATE_USABLE_P(sav)) {
8442 /* We don't need to care about the order */
8443 SAVLIST_WRITER_INSERT_HEAD(sav->sah, state, sav);
8444 return;
8445 }
8446 /*
8447 * Sort the list by lft_c->sadb_lifetime_addtime
8448 * in ascending order.
8449 */
8450 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(_sav, sav->sah, state) {
8451 if (_sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_addtime >
8452 sav->lft_c->sadb_lifetime_addtime) {
8453 SAVLIST_WRITER_INSERT_BEFORE(_sav, sav);
8454 break;
8455 }
8456 }
8457 if (_sav == NULL) {
8458 SAVLIST_WRITER_INSERT_TAIL(sav->sah, state, sav);
8459 }
8460
8461 SAVLUT_WRITER_INSERT_HEAD(sav);
8462
8463 key_validate_savlist(sav->sah, state);
8464}
8465
8466/* XXX too much? */
8467static struct mbuf *
8468key_alloc_mbuf(int l, int mflag)
8469{
8470 struct mbuf *m = NULL, *n;
8471 int len, t;
8472
8473 KASSERT(mflag == M_NOWAIT || (mflag == M_WAITOK && !cpu_softintr_p()));
8474
8475 len = l;
8476 while (len > 0) {
8477 MGET(n, mflag, MT_DATA);
8478 if (n && len > MLEN) {
8479 MCLGET(n, mflag);
8480 if ((n->m_flags & M_EXT) == 0) {
8481 m_freem(n);
8482 n = NULL;
8483 }
8484 }
8485 if (!n) {
8486 m_freem(m);
8487 return NULL;
8488 }
8489
8490 n->m_next = NULL;
8491 n->m_len = 0;
8492 n->m_len = M_TRAILINGSPACE(n);
8493 /* use the bottom of mbuf, hoping we can prepend afterwards */
8494 if (n->m_len > len) {
8495 t = (n->m_len - len) & ~(sizeof(long) - 1);
8496 n->m_data += t;
8497 n->m_len = len;
8498 }
8499
8500 len -= n->m_len;
8501
8502 if (m)
8503 m_cat(m, n);
8504 else
8505 m = n;
8506 }
8507
8508 return m;
8509}
8510
8511static struct mbuf *
8512key_setdump(u_int8_t req_satype, int *errorp, uint32_t pid)
8513{
8514 struct secashead *sah;
8515 struct secasvar *sav;
8516 u_int16_t proto;
8517 u_int8_t satype;
8518 u_int8_t state;
8519 int cnt;
8520 struct mbuf *m, *n;
8521
8522 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_sad.lock));
8523
8524 /* map satype to proto */
8525 proto = key_satype2proto(req_satype);
8526 if (proto == 0) {
8527 *errorp = EINVAL;
8528 return (NULL);
8529 }
8530
8531 /* count sav entries to be sent to the userland. */
8532 cnt = 0;
8533 SAHLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sah) {
8534 if (req_satype != SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC &&
8535 proto != sah->saidx.proto)
8536 continue;
8537
8538 SASTATE_ANY_FOREACH(state) {
8539 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
8540 cnt++;
8541 }
8542 }
8543 }
8544
8545 if (cnt == 0) {
8546 *errorp = ENOENT;
8547 return (NULL);
8548 }
8549
8550 /* send this to the userland, one at a time. */
8551 m = NULL;
8552 SAHLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sah) {
8553 if (req_satype != SADB_SATYPE_UNSPEC &&
8554 proto != sah->saidx.proto)
8555 continue;
8556
8557 /* map proto to satype */
8558 satype = key_proto2satype(sah->saidx.proto);
8559 if (satype == 0) {
8560 m_freem(m);
8561 *errorp = EINVAL;
8562 return (NULL);
8563 }
8564
8565 SASTATE_ANY_FOREACH(state) {
8566 SAVLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sav, sah, state) {
8567 n = key_setdumpsa(sav, SADB_DUMP, satype,
8568 --cnt, pid);
8569 if (!m)
8570 m = n;
8571 else
8572 m_cat(m, n);
8573 }
8574 }
8575 }
8576
8577 if (!m) {
8578 *errorp = EINVAL;
8579 return (NULL);
8580 }
8581
8582 if ((m->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) != 0) {
8583 m->m_pkthdr.len = 0;
8584 for (n = m; n; n = n->m_next)
8585 m->m_pkthdr.len += n->m_len;
8586 }
8587
8588 *errorp = 0;
8589 return (m);
8590}
8591
8592static struct mbuf *
8593key_setspddump(int *errorp, pid_t pid)
8594{
8595 struct secpolicy *sp;
8596 int cnt;
8597 u_int dir;
8598 struct mbuf *m, *n;
8599
8600 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_spd.lock));
8601
8602 /* search SPD entry and get buffer size. */
8603 cnt = 0;
8604 for (dir = 0; dir < IPSEC_DIR_MAX; dir++) {
8605 SPLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sp, dir) {
8606 cnt++;
8607 }
8608 }
8609
8610 if (cnt == 0) {
8611 *errorp = ENOENT;
8612 return (NULL);
8613 }
8614
8615 m = NULL;
8616 for (dir = 0; dir < IPSEC_DIR_MAX; dir++) {
8617 SPLIST_WRITER_FOREACH(sp, dir) {
8618 --cnt;
8619 n = key_setdumpsp(sp, SADB_X_SPDDUMP, cnt, pid);
8620
8621 if (!m)
8622 m = n;
8623 else {
8624 m->m_pkthdr.len += n->m_pkthdr.len;
8625 m_cat(m, n);
8626 }
8627 }
8628 }
8629
8630 *errorp = 0;
8631 return (m);
8632}
8633
8634int
8635key_get_used(void) {
8636 return !SPLIST_READER_EMPTY(IPSEC_DIR_INBOUND) ||
8637 !SPLIST_READER_EMPTY(IPSEC_DIR_OUTBOUND) ||
8638 !SOCKSPLIST_READER_EMPTY();
8639}
8640
8641void
8642key_update_used(void)
8643{
8644 switch (ipsec_enabled) {
8645 default:
8646 case 0:
8647#ifdef notyet
8648 /* XXX: racy */
8649 ipsec_used = 0;
8650#endif
8651 break;
8652 case 1:
8653#ifndef notyet
8654 /* XXX: racy */
8655 if (!ipsec_used)
8656#endif
8657 ipsec_used = key_get_used();
8658 break;
8659 case 2:
8660 ipsec_used = 1;
8661 break;
8662 }
8663}
8664
8665static inline void
8666key_savlut_writer_insert_head(struct secasvar *sav)
8667{
8668 uint32_t hash_key;
8669 uint32_t hash;
8670
8671 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&key_sad.lock));
8672 KASSERT(!sav->savlut_added);
8673
8674 if (sav->sah->saidx.proto == IPPROTO_IPCOMP)
8675 hash_key = sav->alg_comp;
8676 else
8677 hash_key = sav->spi;
8678
8679 hash = key_savluthash(&sav->sah->saidx.dst.sa,
8680 sav->sah->saidx.proto, hash_key, key_sad.savlutmask);
8681
8682 PSLIST_WRITER_INSERT_HEAD(&key_sad.savlut[hash], sav,
8683 pslist_entry_savlut);
8684 sav->savlut_added = true;
8685}
8686
8687/*
8688 * Calculate hash using protocol, source address,
8689 * and destination address included in saidx.
8690 */
8691static inline uint32_t
8692key_saidxhash(const struct secasindex *saidx, u_long mask)
8693{
8694 uint32_t hash32;
8695 const struct sockaddr_in *sin;
8696 const struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
8697
8698 hash32 = saidx->proto;
8699
8700 switch (saidx->src.sa.sa_family) {
8701 case AF_INET:
8702 sin = &saidx->src.sin;
8703 hash32 = hash32_buf(&sin->sin_addr,
8704 sizeof(sin->sin_addr), hash32);
8705 sin = &saidx->dst.sin;
8706 hash32 = hash32_buf(&sin->sin_addr,
8707 sizeof(sin->sin_addr), hash32 << 1);
8708 break;
8709 case AF_INET6:
8710 sin6 = &saidx->src.sin6;
8711 hash32 = hash32_buf(&sin6->sin6_addr,
8712 sizeof(sin6->sin6_addr), hash32);
8713 sin6 = &saidx->dst.sin6;
8714 hash32 = hash32_buf(&sin6->sin6_addr,
8715 sizeof(sin6->sin6_addr), hash32 << 1);
8716 break;
8717 default:
8718 hash32 = 0;
8719 break;
8720 }
8721
8722 return hash32 & mask;
8723}
8724
8725/*
8726 * Calculate hash using destination address, protocol,
8727 * and spi. Those parameter depend on the search of
8728 * key_lookup_sa().
8729 */
8730static uint32_t
8731key_savluthash(const struct sockaddr *dst, uint32_t proto,
8732 uint32_t spi, u_long mask)
8733{
8734 uint32_t hash32;
8735 const struct sockaddr_in *sin;
8736 const struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
8737
8738 hash32 = hash32_buf(&proto, sizeof(proto), spi);
8739
8740 switch(dst->sa_family) {
8741 case AF_INET:
8742 sin = satocsin(dst);
8743 hash32 = hash32_buf(&sin->sin_addr,
8744 sizeof(sin->sin_addr), hash32);
8745 break;
8746 case AF_INET6:
8747 sin6 = satocsin6(dst);
8748 hash32 = hash32_buf(&sin6->sin6_addr,
8749 sizeof(sin6->sin6_addr), hash32);
8750 break;
8751 default:
8752 hash32 = 0;
8753 }
8754
8755 return hash32 & mask;
8756}
8757
8758static int
8759sysctl_net_key_dumpsa(SYSCTLFN_ARGS)
8760{
8761 struct mbuf *m, *n;
8762 int err2 = 0;
8763 char *p, *ep;
8764 size_t len;
8765 int error;
8766
8767 if (newp)
8768 return (EPERM);
8769 if (namelen != 1)
8770 return (EINVAL);
8771
8772 mutex_enter(&key_sad.lock);
8773 m = key_setdump(name[0], &error, l->l_proc->p_pid);
8774 mutex_exit(&key_sad.lock);
8775 if (!m)
8776 return (error);
8777 if (!oldp)
8778 *oldlenp = m->m_pkthdr.len;
8779 else {
8780 p = oldp;
8781 if (*oldlenp < m->m_pkthdr.len) {
8782 err2 = ENOMEM;
8783 ep = p + *oldlenp;
8784 } else {
8785 *oldlenp = m->m_pkthdr.len;
8786 ep = p + m->m_pkthdr.len;
8787 }
8788 for (n = m; n; n = n->m_next) {
8789 len = (ep - p < n->m_len) ?
8790 ep - p : n->m_len;
8791 error = copyout(mtod(n, const void *), p, len);
8792 p += len;
8793 if (error)
8794 break;
8795 }
8796 if (error == 0)
8797 error = err2;
8798 }
8799 m_freem(m);
8800
8801 return (error);
8802}
8803
8804static int
8805sysctl_net_key_dumpsp(SYSCTLFN_ARGS)
8806{
8807 struct mbuf *m, *n;
8808 int err2 = 0;
8809 char *p, *ep;
8810 size_t len;
8811 int error;
8812
8813 if (newp)
8814 return (EPERM);
8815 if (namelen != 0)
8816 return (EINVAL);
8817
8818 mutex_enter(&key_spd.lock);
8819 m = key_setspddump(&error, l->l_proc->p_pid);
8820 mutex_exit(&key_spd.lock);
8821 if (!m)
8822 return (error);
8823 if (!oldp)
8824 *oldlenp = m->m_pkthdr.len;
8825 else {
8826 p = oldp;
8827 if (*oldlenp < m->m_pkthdr.len) {
8828 err2 = ENOMEM;
8829 ep = p + *oldlenp;
8830 } else {
8831 *oldlenp = m->m_pkthdr.len;
8832 ep = p + m->m_pkthdr.len;
8833 }
8834 for (n = m; n; n = n->m_next) {
8835 len = (ep - p < n->m_len) ? ep - p : n->m_len;
8836 error = copyout(mtod(n, const void *), p, len);
8837 p += len;
8838 if (error)
8839 break;
8840 }
8841 if (error == 0)
8842 error = err2;
8843 }
8844 m_freem(m);
8845
8846 return (error);
8847}
8848
8849/*
8850 * Create sysctl tree for native IPSEC key knobs, originally
8851 * under name "net.keyv2" * with MIB number { CTL_NET, PF_KEY_V2. }.
8852 * However, sysctl(8) never checked for nodes under { CTL_NET, PF_KEY_V2 };
8853 * and in any case the part of our sysctl namespace used for dumping the
8854 * SPD and SA database *HAS* to be compatible with the KAME sysctl
8855 * namespace, for API reasons.
8856 *
8857 * Pending a consensus on the right way to fix this, add a level of
8858 * indirection in how we number the `native' IPSEC key nodes;
8859 * and (as requested by Andrew Brown) move registration of the
8860 * KAME-compatible names to a separate function.
8861 */
8862#if 0
8863# define IPSEC_PFKEY PF_KEY_V2
8864# define IPSEC_PFKEY_NAME "keyv2"
8865#else
8866# define IPSEC_PFKEY PF_KEY
8867# define IPSEC_PFKEY_NAME "key"
8868#endif
8869
8870static int
8871sysctl_net_key_stats(SYSCTLFN_ARGS)
8872{
8873
8874 return (NETSTAT_SYSCTL(pfkeystat_percpu, PFKEY_NSTATS));
8875}
8876
8877static void
8878sysctl_net_keyv2_setup(struct sysctllog **clog)
8879{
8880
8881 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8882 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT,
8883 CTLTYPE_NODE, IPSEC_PFKEY_NAME, NULL,
8884 NULL, 0, NULL, 0,
8885 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, CTL_EOL);
8886
8887 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8888 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8889 CTLTYPE_INT, "debug", NULL,
8890 NULL, 0, &key_debug_level, 0,
8891 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_DEBUG_LEVEL, CTL_EOL);
8892 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8893 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8894 CTLTYPE_INT, "spi_try", NULL,
8895 NULL, 0, &key_spi_trycnt, 0,
8896 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_SPI_TRY, CTL_EOL);
8897 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8898 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8899 CTLTYPE_INT, "spi_min_value", NULL,
8900 NULL, 0, &key_spi_minval, 0,
8901 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_SPI_MIN_VALUE, CTL_EOL);
8902 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8903 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8904 CTLTYPE_INT, "spi_max_value", NULL,
8905 NULL, 0, &key_spi_maxval, 0,
8906 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_SPI_MAX_VALUE, CTL_EOL);
8907 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8908 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8909 CTLTYPE_INT, "random_int", NULL,
8910 NULL, 0, &key_int_random, 0,
8911 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_RANDOM_INT, CTL_EOL);
8912 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8913 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8914 CTLTYPE_INT, "larval_lifetime", NULL,
8915 NULL, 0, &key_larval_lifetime, 0,
8916 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_LARVAL_LIFETIME, CTL_EOL);
8917 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8918 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8919 CTLTYPE_INT, "blockacq_count", NULL,
8920 NULL, 0, &key_blockacq_count, 0,
8921 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_BLOCKACQ_COUNT, CTL_EOL);
8922 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8923 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8924 CTLTYPE_INT, "blockacq_lifetime", NULL,
8925 NULL, 0, &key_blockacq_lifetime, 0,
8926 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_BLOCKACQ_LIFETIME, CTL_EOL);
8927 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8928 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8929 CTLTYPE_INT, "esp_keymin", NULL,
8930 NULL, 0, &ipsec_esp_keymin, 0,
8931 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_ESP_KEYMIN, CTL_EOL);
8932 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8933 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8934 CTLTYPE_INT, "prefered_oldsa", NULL,
8935 NULL, 0, &key_prefered_oldsa, 0,
8936 CTL_NET, PF_KEY, KEYCTL_PREFERED_OLDSA, CTL_EOL);
8937 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8938 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8939 CTLTYPE_INT, "esp_auth", NULL,
8940 NULL, 0, &ipsec_esp_auth, 0,
8941 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_ESP_AUTH, CTL_EOL);
8942 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8943 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT|CTLFLAG_READWRITE,
8944 CTLTYPE_INT, "ah_keymin", NULL,
8945 NULL, 0, &ipsec_ah_keymin, 0,
8946 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, KEYCTL_AH_KEYMIN, CTL_EOL);
8947 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8948 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT,
8949 CTLTYPE_STRUCT, "stats",
8950 SYSCTL_DESCR("PF_KEY statistics"),
8951 sysctl_net_key_stats, 0, NULL, 0,
8952 CTL_NET, IPSEC_PFKEY, CTL_CREATE, CTL_EOL);
8953}
8954
8955/*
8956 * Register sysctl names used by setkey(8). For historical reasons,
8957 * and to share a single API, these names appear under { CTL_NET, PF_KEY }
8958 * for both IPSEC and KAME IPSEC.
8959 */
8960static void
8961sysctl_net_key_compat_setup(struct sysctllog **clog)
8962{
8963
8964 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8965 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT,
8966 CTLTYPE_NODE, "key", NULL,
8967 NULL, 0, NULL, 0,
8968 CTL_NET, PF_KEY, CTL_EOL);
8969
8970 /* Register the net.key.dump{sa,sp} nodes used by setkey(8). */
8971 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8972 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT,
8973 CTLTYPE_STRUCT, "dumpsa", NULL,
8974 sysctl_net_key_dumpsa, 0, NULL, 0,
8975 CTL_NET, PF_KEY, KEYCTL_DUMPSA, CTL_EOL);
8976 sysctl_createv(clog, 0, NULL, NULL,
8977 CTLFLAG_PERMANENT,
8978 CTLTYPE_STRUCT, "dumpsp", NULL,
8979 sysctl_net_key_dumpsp, 0, NULL, 0,
8980 CTL_NET, PF_KEY, KEYCTL_DUMPSP, CTL_EOL);
8981}
8982
